loans.name: Liva

texts.en:
Liva is fifty seven years of age and is married with four children. Liva owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Liva needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Liva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Liva's 4th loan with SPBD. 



*

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Johnstone Shamia

texts.en:
Johnstone Shamia  is a 56-year-old electrician who also owns an electrical appliances shop in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is married. He has been selling electrical appliances and doing electronics repairs for the last two years with success. 

This is Johnstone’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase more sockets, soldering wires and bulbs. He will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses and expand his business further. He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sockets, soldering wires and bulbs.

loans.name: Adin

texts.en:
Adin is 26 years old and married with one child. Adin works very hard to provide for them.

Adin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Adin has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Adin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Agbéko

texts.en:
Born in Akoumapé-Kpota in 1966, Mr. Agbéko N. is the second son in a family of ten children. His parents had no concept of educating their children, and he was not able to go to school. He learned carpentry, but it took quite a while for him to set up shop because he lacked the resources. He received a $450 credit to open a workshop, but it was not well equipped. Despite all his talent, his work well done and his dynamic nature, he could not effectively meet the demand of his clients. Plunged into further difficulties, Mr. N. found a new strategy for attracting clients: building furniture and displaying it in front of his workshop. This highly profitable activity requires a large financial investment, and so Mr. N. is asking for $1000 in financial support to outfit his workshop and buy small tools and wood for making and selling furniture. This will increase his business and his income, and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1966 à Akoumapé-Kpota, Monsieur N. Agbéko est le deuxième fils d’une famille de dix enfants. Ses parents ignorent toute notion de scolarisation des enfants et il n’a pu aller à l’école. Il apprit la menuiserie, mais a mis assez de temps pour s’installer par manque de moyens. Il obtient un crédit de $450 pour ouvrir un atelier mais très mal équipé. Malgré tout son talent, son travail bien fait et son dynamisme, il ne parvient pas à répondre efficacement à la forte demande de la clientèle. Plongé davantage dans les difficultés, Monsieur N. Agbéko a trouvé une nouvelle stratégie pour séduire sa clientèle : fabriquer des meubles et les exposer devant son atelier. Cette activité très rentable demande assez de moyens financiers et Monsieur N. sollicite un appui financier de $1000 qui va servir à aménager son atelier, à acheter de petit outillage et du bois pour la fabrication et vente des meubles. Ce qui va accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To outfit his workshop and buy wood and small tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Born in 1945, Christina is married and has five children. She is getting old but none of her children is able to support her because of unemployment and so she has to fend for herself. She fell seriously sick and there was no one to look after her pineapple farm and so thieves broke into it and made away with all the ripe fruits. Motivated by this, she joined GHAPE in 2004 and received her first loan of $40 which she used in opening up a poultry business. With the increased demand for pineapples by members of her community, there is need for her to revamp her pineapple farm.

With a loan of $400, Christina hopes to plant more pineapples, buy more chicks for her poultry business and some vaccines. The profit she gets from this business will be used to earn a living and to pay fee for her child who is learning a trade.

loans.use: Growing of pineapples and rearing of fowls.

loans.name: Claudia Alejandra

texts.es:
Claudia has three daughters. Six years ago she and her husband got a divorce, and since she received no support whatsoever from her ex, she started her own haberdashery and natural product business as a means to keep her family moving forward. Little by little, she has increased her product variety and incorporated selling paper supplies, and has made her business grow with the help of her oldest daughter, 14. Love for her children and the desire to provide for them is a constant motivator.

Currently, Claudia needs a loan of $825, which she will use to purchase supplies in order to meet her customers' demands. She plans to repay it within six months. Your help is a great blessing for this family, and they are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Claudia tiene tres hijas, hace cuatro años se divorcio y como no recibía ningún tipo de ayuda de su ex esposo, para poder salir adelante con sus hijos inició su propio negocio con la venta de mercería y productos naturales, poco a poco ha incrementado la variedad de productos que ofrece incorporando la venta de papelería y ha hecho crecer su negocio donde la ayuda de su hija mayor, de 14 años de edad. El amor hacia sus hijas y el deseo de darles lo necesario han motivado todo este tiempo a Claudia para esforzarse cada día más.

En estos momentos Claudia necesita un préstamo de $ 825 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda es de gran bendición para esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudarlas.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ligia Argentina

texts.es: Ligia Argentina G. H. is from Bluefields. She is 25 years old, and is a single mother with two children, who are 9 and 6 years old. For the past five years, Ligia has been selling shoes for people of all ages. The advantage of this business is that sales are good and shoes don’t change styles as quickly as clothing. With this business, this young mother has been able to get ahead on her own, with her two children who are currently studying. She buys women’s shoes at $12.00 per pair, men’s shoes at $16.00 per pair, and children’s shoes at $5.00 per pair.   Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer. Ligia Argentina G. H. es originaria de Bluefields,tiene 25 años, es madre soltera con dos hijos de 9 y 6 años respectivamente. Ligia se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de calzados para todas las edades. Este negocio tiene la ventaja que el calzado se vende mucho y casi no cambia de moda tan rapido como la ropa. Con este negocio esta joven madre a podido salir adelante sola con sus dos hijos quienes en la actualidad se encuentran estudiando. Los pares de zapatos de mujer los compra en 12 dolares cada uno, los pares de zapatos de hombre los compra en 16 dolares cada uno y los tenis de niños en 5 dolares cada uno.

loans.use: This loan is needed for the purchase of 8 pairs of women’s shoes, 8 pairs of men’s shoes, and 8 pairs of children’s tennis shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Falelua

texts.en: Falelua is a 67 year old mother. She is married with eight children. She is still very active and helps out with her family’s fishing and plantation business. Falelua is one of the oldest members of SPBD and she is also a center chief of the Safaatoa Tai village borrowing center.  This will be her fifth loan. She will use it to purchase supplies for her plantation and to improve her home. She makes $350 WST ($140 USD) per week, which she uses to meet family needs like church donations, bils, and food. She will also use the income to repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a determined mother who has been working since she was only seven years old. She spent her childhood selling jellies out of necessity to help her family. Shortly after she was married she had the new responsibility of providing for her children, although her husband also worked. With a lot of hard work she was able to stick with what she knew, selling her jellies at different public events. All these years she has been exposed to the sun's intense rays and never interrupted her work despite needing medical care for spots on her skin. After a struggle within her heart, she decided to keep working for the well being of her beloved children and with that goal she's asking to find it in your kind and noble heart to help her purchase larger quantities of ingredients for her delicious jellies and invest in her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Vilma, es una empeñosa madre que trabaja de manera sostenida desde que tenía apenas siete años de edad. Su niñez la ha pasado ofertando gelatinas ante la necesidad económica por las que atravesaba su familia. Poco después de haber contraído matrimonio la responsabilidad de brindar comodidades a sus pequeños hijos a pesar de que su esposo también trabaja la ha conducido a mantener con muchas fuerzas la actividad que ya conoce y disfruta comercializar sus productos en diferentes eventos públicos.Todos estos años ha estado expuesta a los intensos rayos solares y no ha interrumpido sus labores a pesar de encontrarse en tratamiento médico; debido a la presencia de manchas en su piel. A pesar de tener una lucha interna en su corazón, desea seguir trabajando para procurarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos con este propósito solicita la ayuda de vuestro bondadoso y noble corazón a fin de invertir la cantidad que le otorgues en la compre de mayor cantidad de insumos para sus deliciosas gelatinas y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make her jellies and invest in her children's education.

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
Elbrus was born in 1975, which makes him 33 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan of the Fizuli region. There, he lives in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He is married, has one child.

Elbrus has run a clothing business for the past five years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes and shoes in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Adelma

texts.es: ADELMA, desde hace dos años se dedica al alquiler de mototaxis para transportar a las personas de su comunidad a sus diferentes destinos, con estas herramientas obtiene diariamente el sustento necesario para sus pequeños hijos, lamentablemente de un tiempo a esta parte su familia a tenido serias dificultades económicas debido a los desperfectos que han ido manifestando las motos. Con el deseo de mejorar su capacidad y ofrecer un mejor y rápido servicio solicita un préstamo para poner en marcha su plan de reparación.

loans.use: Reparación de sus herramientas de trabajo.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a fifty-two-year old married mother of three children. All of the children are grown, except for the youngest, who is in polytechnical school.

Paulina has been selling bananas and plantains in Accra’s busy Agblogbloshie market for over twenty years. She purchases her products through suppliers and then sells them to local hotels, restaurants, and streetside vendors in Accra. She will use the loan to expand her inventory of bananas and plantains and guard against price hikes. She hopes to use the proceeds of her increased sales to complete the rebuilding of her house.

Paulina is a member of the "Awurade Kae Me" (Remember Me, God) lending group. The lending group works with a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: To buy more plantains and bananas in bulk quantities

loans.name: Betty Nabuuma's Group

texts.en:
Betty is a leader of a group of 5 members. She is 40 years old and is married with 4 children, who are all in school. They are aged 17, 12, 11 and 9. The area in which she operates her business and lives, is low-lying and a slum. It floods during the rainy season and the community is semi-urban.

She displays her grocery alongside a road, where she has a stall, for people to buy. Her main challenge is working in the open and the seasonality of what she sells. When there is scarcity, the prices run so high that the clientele shrinks, and the prices run very low in times of abundance. The short life of vegetables sometimes forces her to sell them off at low prices to avoid total loss. There is a market for her business.

She can now pay school dues on time and contribute to the running of the home. She intends to continue increasing her stock in order to invest more in her children’s education and buy a plot of land for the eventual building of a house. Betty has successfully paid back more than 5 loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock, invest more in her children’s education, and buy a plot of land for the eventual building of a house.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga learned how to embroider from her mother when she was a girl. Now that she has her own family, she decided to begin embroidering as a business. This way she helps her husband, who works as a bricklayer and does not have a steady income. She started working from home 8 years ago when her acquaintances began to ask her to embroider some clothing.

She now needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy material and thread so she can finish some embroidery work she has pending. With your help, Olga will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Olga aprendió a bordar desde niña con su mama, ahora que ya tiene su propia familia decidió empezar a bordar como negocio y con eso ayuda a su pareja quien trabaja como albañil, por lo que su ingreso no es seguro. Comenzó hace 8 años en casa, cuando entre sus mismos conocidos le empezaron a pedir que les bordara algunas prendas.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir la tela y los hilos para poder terminar los bordados que tiene pendientes. Con tu ayuda Olga saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy supplies for her work.

loans.name: Vilma Maritza

texts.es:
Vilma is 27 years old, finished high school, speaks Spanish and Aymara, she lives with the father of her children, has two boys and owns her house which is located in Queñuani village, in the district of Yunguyo.

She works selling cows and sheep in the Yunyugo fair, in Huapaca, for the last 5 years.

She is a member of the community bank “Vista Alegre”, she started with a loan of S/. 300.00 new soles that she used to buy six sheep.

With the loan of S/. 600.00 new soles, that will be cancelled in 4 payments, she will buy a bull, that she will rise for a couple of months and then will be sold.

She learned to be responsible and organized. She is very thankful of the loan because it will help her increase her working capital.

Her dream is to build a house with good materials, support her kids’ studies and increase her cattle for the business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 27 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, habla castellano y aymará, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos varones, su casa es propia y está ubicada en villa Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo. Ella se dedica a la venta de vacas y ovejas en la feria de Yunguyo, Huapaca, desde hace ya cinco años. También es socia del Banco comunal "Vista Alegre" al inicio tuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compro seis ovejas. Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará un toro, el cual criará un par de meses luego será vendido. Ella aprendió a ser responsable, organizada. Esta muy agradecida con el crédito porque le permite aumentar su capital de trabajo. El sueño anhelado es tener una casa de material noble, hacer estudiar sus hijos y incrementar su ganado que tiene para la venta.

loans.use: To buy cattle (a bull) / Compra de ganado (toro).

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness is 37 years old. She is a married with three children, aged 20, 14, and 6. She sells clothing. Everyday, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Happiness now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada S. was born in 1983 and she is from Lukavac. She produces vegetables in a greenhouse, together with her mother. Now is the season of tomatoes and they are expecting good income from selling this produce.

Also, Senada sells cosmetics and she earns about 100 KM monthly. This is her first loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM and she will buy a new nylon for the greenhouse. In this way, her greenhouse will be ready for the new season. Her wish is to create conditions for producing vegetables the whole year round and not just in season.

loans.use: To buy nylon for her greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite.

loans.name: Noimot

texts.en: Noimot, 35 years old and happily married with three children, has sold dried fish and river fish for the past two years in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is now requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their generous contribution to women in Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and river fish to sell.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann T. is 51 years old, married, and has a child who is currently attending a local school. Mrs. Vann T. lives in the Krodas Khor village in Kampong Cham Province. She earns income breeding chicken, while her husband, Mr. Chhet Lock, cultivates rice on a piece of land that the couple owns. The rice field, however, is not sufficiently productive, and Mrs. Vann T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the fertility of the soil.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to improve the productivity of a rice farming business

loans.name: Mrs. Latt Morn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who live in Preaek Khmer Village in Kandal Province make up the village bank and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Latt M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it and so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to improve her living conditions after she sells her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Roueng Doeb, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Latt M. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest, who is only one, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and sale.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.en:
Alcy E. is the coordinator of group 5, in the Bank of Hope Paz y Amor, which has 30 borrowers divided among 6 groups of 5 people. The five people in her group are involved in various businesses and will share the loan.
 
Alcy E. is 40 years old. She is married; her husband is 38. They have two girls, 17 and 19 years old. E. works as a street vendor, selling clothes, shoes, and also food. She works in the district of Sosua. She previously received a loan from Esperanza. This will be her second loan. The first loan made it possible for her to expand her business and increase her monthly sales. With her new loan she hopes to increase her sales even further. Alcy E. hopes that one day will be able to buy a nice house for her family. She is also concerned about the future of her children. Her oldest child has completed a year of medical school, and Alcy E. hopes to see her daughter become a doctor.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes for resale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Danaya est composé de cinq (05) femmes toutes mariées et ayant en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants, vivent dans des familles monogamiques dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (la 4ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles ont comme activités génératrices de revenu l’achat et la vente des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, des pagnes et des bazins teintés. 
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle qu’elles ont décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir bien remboursé tous les 5  prêts précédents elles sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe)
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, plusieurs objets en plastiques tels : 6 douzaines de pots, 3 douzaines de seaux, 3 douzaines de bassine, 13 douzaines de petites tasses, une douzaine de barrique et 33 pièces de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique). 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Ségou pour l’ensemble des articles auprès des grossistes. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit  au grand marché de Ségou et en ambulant dans les quartiers pour les pagnes wax à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000FCA  qui sera utilisé pour l’achat des fournitures scolaires des enfants et les petits besoins de la famille (savon et complément du prix des condiments). 
 Elles ambitionnent avoir un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of five (05) women, all married, on average 35 years old with 5 children, who live in monogamous households in the Darsalam area of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of Mali). They run as income-generating businesses the purchase and sale of plastic cooking utensils, pagnes (a type of West African cloth), and tinted "bazin" cloth. It was with the aim of satisfying the needs of their clientele that these women decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having repaid all 5 previous loans without incident, they are seeking their 6th group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy several pastic objects such as : 6 dozen pots, 3 dozen buckets, 3 dozen basins, one dozen barrels, and 33 pieces of pagnes wax (a highly prized African cloth). They supply themselves at the main market in Ségou with all their items from wholesalers. They re-sell at retail, in cash or in credit, at the main market in Ségou and wandering through other areas, their pagnes wax to a clientele composed to men and women. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 26,000 FCFA, which will be used to buy school supplies for the children and small household goods (soap and condiments). They strive ultimately to have a housing plot.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic utensils and pagnes wax

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jorge Antonio labora para una maquiladora desde hace un año, como operador de línea, su esposa la señora Mayra trabaja como encargada del área de limpieza en una boutique de la ciudad; ellos están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones y alambreras para la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Antonio has been working at an assembly plant for a year as a line operator. His wife Mayra works at a boutique in the city, where she is in charge of cleaning. They are requesting this loan to put in place security measures and window screens, for the safety of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection measures and window screens in residence

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store as a sales point. Esther is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Esther hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a charcoal store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells sarongs of various colours to her customers. She hawks her sarongs from street to street in her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. The demand for her sarongs is high and she hopes to meet these demands of her customers. She is applying for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is 40-years-old and married with three children.
Mary says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Khouder

texts.en:
Khouder has been working as an electrician. Khouder knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Khouder is a 48-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife.

Khouder has requested a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Khouder has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
K. Blandine est âgée de trente quatre (34) ans; elle est née à Lokossa dans le Département du Mono. Blandine est mariée à un Conducteur de taxi ville. Blandine vend des produits vivriers (maïs, mil, sorgho, arachide, haricot, farine de manioc et de causette d’igname) au grand marché international du Bénin (Dantokpa) à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Blandine aide énormément son mari dans les charges du ménage. Blandine finance également les études de ses frères et sœurs toujours grâce au revenu de son activité. Blandine a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter le volume de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Blandine sollicite de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Blandine is 34 years old and was born in Lokossa, in Mono County. She is married to a city taxi driver. She sells staple foods (corn, millet, sorghum, peanuts, beans, cassava flour, and yam chips) at the grand international market of Benin (Dantokpa) in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Thanks to the revenues from her business, she is helping her husband enormously with household expenses. She is also financing the schooling for her brothers and sisters, again, thanks to those revenues. Blandine has already been the recipient of four loans with Alidé for developing her business. To bolster her working capital and to increase her business volume, so as to do better in satisfying her customers, she’s requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of beans, and a sack of peanuts

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a single mother of two, has always loved children. She received her degree in child psychology and worked in the field for more than 35 years before moving to California and opening her own daycare.

In 2008, Maria got her first loan from Opportunity Fund and opened a daycare in her home. Today she cares for three children and focuses on educational activities such as memory games, shapes and color recognition, alphabet sounds and letters. 

Maria is ready to care for more children, but needs to invest in more supplies to do so. With an $8,000 loan, Maria will be able to purchase new equipment and educational supplies and to buy a computer and printer. 

Maria is going back to get her preschool teacher certification and expand her business.

loans.use: Computer, printer, educational supplies

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina L. works in a family member's specialized retail store selling a variety of food products in the local community. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Langub, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Adelina has been in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Adelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 16th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi tiene 34 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive junto a su esposo quien es agricultor. Tiene una chacra ubicada en un caserío río arriba a dos horas de viaje en bote, donde siembra y cultiva verduras regionales como el culantro, caigua, ajíes, tomates, etc., además de plátanos. Para esta labor cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es el encargado de mantener en buen estado sus productos y cuando están listos para el consumo los envía a Deysi, quien los vende en el mercado de su localidad. A ella le gusta mucho este trabajo porque es un negocio tranquilo y rentable y porque sus productos los vende frescos tal y como les gustan a sus clientes. Para más adelante, Deysi quiere incursionar en la siembra de camu camu, ya que su terreno es adecuado para este producto rico en vitamina C. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque le dan la oportunidad de salir adelante y sobre todo porque observó que son personas responsables donde prima la comunicación. El dinero que viene solicitando comprará granos (maíz, fríjol y maní) para sembrar, ya que es temporada adecuada para estos productos.
texts.en:
Deysi is 34 years old, a mother of 4, and lives with her husband who is a farmer. Her land is located in a village two hours by boat where she farms regional vegetables such as coriander, "caigua", pepper, tomatoe , etc. as well as bananas. Her husband supports her as he checks and keeps her products in good state and when they are ready to be harvested he sends them to Deysi who sells tham on the local market. She likes her work very much because it is a calm and profitable business and because her products are fresh and her clients appreciate that. In the future Deysi would like to farm "camu camu" as her land is adequate for farming this product rich in vitamin C. This is her first loan with MFP, she likes to work with her community bank as it offers her the opportunity of getting ahead and she has also found that they are responsible persons with good communicaion. With the loan she will buy grains (corn, beans, and peanuts) to sow as it is the farming season for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains for sowing

loans.name: Makare

texts.fr: makare N. est recemment societaire a la caisse de baye laye.son activite principale est celle de tailleur.mais elle evolue aussi dans le domaine du transport.c'est un pere de famille qui veut developper son activite a travers la vente d'habits cousus pour mieux assister sa famille.elle sollicite un credit de deux cent mille(200 000)frs.
texts.en:
Nakare Nang has recently become a member of the lending bank of Baye Laye. He mainly works as a tailor. But he is developing in the transport domain. This father of a family wants to develop his business through sales in stitched clothing in order to assist his family further. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investments

loans.name: Virginia Auxiliadora

texts.es: La joven Virginia de 24 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad,  su esposo trabaja en la mecánica, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, sus planes es terminar de hacer su casa y poder dar a sus hijos una vida digna. Su negocio es la venta de chatarra el cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo hace cuatro años, con este préstamo quiere construir un cuarto para poder estar en mejores condiciones, ya que su casa la tiene mitad de concreto y el resto de zinc,  lo cual espera terminar pronto de construir y poder gozar de una vivienda digna. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo a través de los préstamos  ya que se ha beneficiado para ir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is a young lady of 24 years, married, and the mother of two children aged 4 and 2. Her husband is a mechanic. They live in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino in the capital city of Managua. Virginia is a scrap iron seller. She started this business four years ago with the help of her husband.

Virginia's plans for the future are to finish the construction of their house and provide their children with a decent life. She will use this loan to build a room of good quality, since their house is made half of concrete and half of zinc. She hopes to finish the construction soon and enjoy decent housing. She thanks our institution for the support given to her through the previous loans, which she used to build their house.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Seirosa

texts.en:
"Seirosa F. (0) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Falevao.  She is married and has 7 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Seirosa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Seirosa has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2004, Seirosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Seirosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1100 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  Seirosa is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Seirosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 55 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Khaled has been working as a furniture repairer and painter. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.
Khaled is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khaled decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies of oil and beans

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin H. is 25 years old, married with two children ages 2 and 3. Celestin and his family live in Nyamata district in the eastern province of Rwanda, approximately one hour from the capital city, Kigali. His village, called Nyamata, is where he has operated his successful business selling different kinds of grocery items and products for three years.

Celestin is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more different types of products and merchandise for sale which he hopes will attract new customers and help him to expand the sales of his business.  With the profit that he hopes to earn from this business expansion plan, he will be able to provide better a better quality of life for his family and a more secure future.

loans.use: Purchase more variety of inventory

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Shiella G. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Shiella is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Shiella operates her family's business of raising and selling coconut crops in the local community. Shiella has been engaged in the business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Shiella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiella is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for resale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shiella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts for resale

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: R. Martine est née en 1970 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Martine est mariée à AHONOUKOU Paul, un prestataire de service. Le couple a six enfants en charge, dont cinq sont leurs propres enfants. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. Martine vit depuis 10 ans à Djeffa dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Martine n'a fait que le cours primaire à l'école. Il y a 10 ans de cela que Martine vend de la nourriture (ailerons frits accompagnés de piron fait à base de farine de manioc). A côté de cela, Martine vend des boissons au Parc MIVVO à Sèmè-Podji. Martine fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Martine sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Martine R. was born in 1970 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Martine is married to Paul Ahonoukou, a contractor. The couple have six children in their care, of whom five are their own. Only some of the children are in school. For 10 years, Martine has lived in Djeffa in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin with her husband and children. The couple provide for the family together. Martine only completed her primary education. For 10 years, Martine has sold food (fried wings accompanied by 'piron' - a type of food paste made from manioc flour). Besides this, Martine sells beverages at the Mivvo Park in Sèmè-Podji. Martine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and has repaid her loans properly. Martine is seeking a fifth loan through ALIDÉ in order to increase her working capital and strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wings, bags of manioc flour, and sauce condiments

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. José Eduardo C. R. tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su padre en la Calle Pimentel 557 – Ica . Tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad el cual vive con su madre por motivos de trabajo pero èl esta pendiente de sus necesidades y siempre le envía dinero para sus gastos.
Es una persona bien responsable con bastante ganas de superación.
Cuenta con un carro propio; el cual lo trabaja diariamente. Actualmente esta trabajando en Cable Visión donde presta sus servicios de transporte aparte trabaja en sus horas libres.
También mantiene un negocio con su madre en la venta de gorros, sombreros y otros productos según campaña y ahora que se acerca la campaña navideña solicita que lo apoyemos para poder invertir y asi obtener un mejor ingreso que le permita apoyar mas a su hijo y a su familia. 
El jóven tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y de la empresa donde está laborando manifiestan que es bien trabajador y sobretodo puntual en sus labores.
texts.en:
José Eduardo C. R., 25, lives with his father on Pimental 557 Street – Ica. He has an eight year old child who lives with his mother because of work. He takes care of the child's necessities, and he always sends money for his child's expenses. He is a very responsible person with a great desire to succeed. He has his own car, which he uses to work everyday. He currently is working for Cable Visión, where he lends his transportation services. He also works during his time off. Additionally, he has a business with his mother. They sell caps, hats, and other products according to the season. Now that the Christmas season is near, he is asking for support to invest. That way he will get better income, which will allow him to help his child and his family more. This young man has good references from his neighbors. The company where he works says that he is a hard-worker, and, above all, he is punctual in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the Christmas season

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: M. Eugénie est née en 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Eugénie réside à Fiégnon à Cotonou, depuis une vingtaine d’année. Mariée à ACHAHOUN Joseph un pêcheur, Eugénie est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement un enfant reste encore à sa charge. Eugénie vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Eugénie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis près de 15 ans, Eugénie mène comme activité, la vente de poissons fumés devant sa maison. C’est au bord de la mer que Eugénie s’approvisionne. Eugénie a obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a bien remboursés. Eugénie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
M. Eugénie was born in 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Eugénie has lived in Fiégnon in Cotonou, for the past 20 years. She is married to Achahoun Joseph, a fisherman; Eugénie is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Only one of the children is still in her care. Eugénie lives with her child and her husband. Together the couple supports the needs of the family. Eugénie did not attend much school. For the past 15 years, Eugénie has managed her business, selling smoked fish from her house. Eugénie supplies herself from the seaside. Eugénie has obtained two loans from ALIDé, and both have been fully repaid. Eugénie is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, in order to improve her business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 11 hijos, 03 que aun están bajo su poder y dependen de ella.

Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de verduras como: (papa, yuca, plátano, maíz molido), se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes fijos, que ya conocen del trabajo que realiza. 

Santos, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su puesto diariamente a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todas las verduras que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará verduras como: racimos de plátanos, sacos de yucas, fréjoles en diferentes variedades, kilos de maíz. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de bolsas mercaderas, así satisfacer a sus clientes.

Santos, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs), which is in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of eleven children, three of whom are still dependent on her.

Motivated by her desire to fulfill her dreams, Santos started her own business selling produce, such as potatoes, cassava, bananas, and cornmeal. Her vending location is in the Central Market in her district, which is well-suited for attending to her customers who have known about her work.

To date, Santos has been gaining customers who come by daily to buy from her she carries all the vegetables that a housewife needs. She personally greets each of her customers with the charisma that she possesses.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will purchase produce such as bananas in bunches, sacks of cassava, beans of different varieties, and kilos of corn. Part of the money will also be used to buy shopping bags so that she can keep her customers happy.

Santos feels very strongly about continuing her work. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her to have opportunities to develop in the communities where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase produce & shopping bags

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es: Sonia Aracely C. A. de 31 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas. Vive junto a su hija de 11 años de edad y un hermano de 17 años, ambos se dedican a trabajar y a ayudarle con el negocio. Sonia posee una tortillería, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa, ahí las personas llegan a recoger las tortillas o las reparten a domicilio con la ayuda de su hija y su hermano, esto último lo hacen con el fin de abarcar mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera poder vender más. Sonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, de manera que cuente con más materia prima y así poder aumentar su producción diaria, ya que hay muchas personas que llegan a comprar tortillas y no se les puede atender por falta de masa para hacerlas. Sonia desea poder obtener mayores ganancias y así contar con una mejor estabilidad económica, lo cual le asegure una mejor vida a su hija y su hermano, los cuales dependen por completo de Sonia.
texts.en:
Sonia Aracely C. A. is 31 years old. She lives in Sensuntepeque, in the department of Cabañas. She lives with her 11-year-old daughter and a 17-year-old brother, who both work and help her with the business. Sonia owns a tortilla shop, which she runs out of her house. People come to pick up the tortillas or she delivers them to their homes with the help of her daughter and brother. They deliver to people's homes so they can attract more clients and sell more tortillas. Sonia is requesting a loan so she can buy more corn and expand her daily production, since a lot of people buy her tortillas and she doesn't have enough to fill everyone's orders. Sonia wants to earn more and attain financial stability, which will help her offer her brother and daughter, who depend on her, a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Anai

texts.en:
Anai J. is currently in the business of selling milk in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase more jerrycans of milk to sell. Anai is 24 years old and married to a farmer. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more cows.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more jerrycans of milk to sell

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
Ma. Loida A. is a married mother of six children. Her husband is a carpenter in the community while she manages her own sewing business to provide additional income for the family.
Ma. Loida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been in business for almost four years. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost four years, she has performed very well in her attendance at center meetings, her steady repayment of loans, and the ongoing nature of her business. Therefore, she has qualified to obtain larger loans.
Now on her fourth loan, Ma. Loida is requesting 20,000 PHP to expand her business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase inventory of cotton, threads, and other supplies, and the remaining money will be used to maintain her sewing machine.
Ma. Loida still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. During her time in ASHI, she has shown herself to be industrious and determined to make her dreams come true.

About ASHI
Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to people at the bottom/the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase cotton, threads, and other supplies, and to maintain her sewing machine

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old, married and the mother of five children. She sells her farm produce to locals who buy and sell in the retail market. This is her primary business and she has been doing it for 20 years. Her husband, Patrick, is a farmer.

Nancy was introduced to KADET by an existing member. This is her first loan with KADET though she has borrowed from her farmers’ society.  She plans to rent some land for farming so that she can get extra income for the upkeep of her family. Her current land is one acre and she wants to get more for a period of at least two years.

Nancy considers herself a very hardworking person and she believes this new investment will increase her income stability in future.

loans.use: To rent some more land to plant tea, kale, spinach and maize

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Juliet is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: EL SR. NICOLAS NACIO EL 6 DE MARZO DE 1980 EN CHUQUISACA, VIVE CON LA SRA. GLADIS, TIENEN 3 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, HACE 10 AÑOS QUE EL SINDICATO QUEBRADA ALBARES LE DOTO UNA PARCELA DE 9HAS. PARA QUE EL TRABAJE EN AGRICULTURA JUSTAMENTE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS 3 HIJOS, EL SIEMBRA PAPA, Y POROTO Y TODOS SUS PRODUCTOS QUE LO COMERCIALIZA EN EL MERCADO DE EL TORNO, ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA QUE BUSCA EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA Y DESEA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
Señor Nicolas was born on March 6th, 1980 in Chuquisaca. He lives with señora Gladis and they have three school-age children. Ten years ago the Quebrada Albares union have him nine hectares of land to farm, together with his wife and three kids. He grows potatoes and beans and sells all of his products in the Torno Market. He is a hard worker who is concerned for his family's well being and he would like to improve his family's quality of life. He is also very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting him with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old. She is married has a one child. She graduated from primary school. 

She is a seamstress and has been working in this field for more than four years. She wants a loan to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. All her customers are female and she is a very skilled and experienced woman. Her sewing is so nice and attractive that most of the ladies of the district come to her. She has a good reputation in the market and her prices are reasonable and cheap.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Shabana Bahar Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is the daughter of H. A. and is the leader of Shabana Bahar Group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 33 and is married.

There are thirteen members in Sharifa’s house and all of them benefit from the income of her husband who has a car-parts shop in the city of Kabul. She wants to take a loan for her husband; with this loan he wants to buy more car parts for his shop and he would like to expand his business.

So, Sharifa has requested a loan. Her husband would like to say that Kiva is an effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more car parts for her husband's shop

loans.name: Nemengo Womens Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
27-year-old N. Fatuma has come a long way in her retail shop business. It has now been four years of hard toiling and constant planning to stay ahead and above her competition.

This married mother of three is full of optimism and it’s one of the factors that has contributed to her elevation. Fatuma is a young woman with every quality to succeed and this can manifestly be shown in the 250,000 shillings she makes in a month.

Fatuma also sells new clothes in her shop and this gives her extra income. She has made sure that all her children are in school. With this loan, she wants to revitalize her business by buying more retail items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items like soap and sugar

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie S. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Jessie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional products to sell. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Miler

texts.es: Miler, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Eva de 33 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que Miler se dedica, es el cultivo de alverja y papa, productos que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado cosechar y del que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado mayorista de tarma. Para él esta actividad es su única fuente de ingreso, de ello depende la tranquilidad de su familia. Han pasado 15 años y aun continua disfrutando de la siembra, pero a veces los cambios bruscos del clima perjudican la producción. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Miler is 42 years old and a loving hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Eva, age 33, and their four beloved children who are the reason behind all of his efforts. Miler grows peas and potatoes, products that require a great deal of effort and work to harvest. These crops have high demand at the wholesale market in Tarma. Farming is his only source of income and provides stability for his family. He has been doing this for 15 years and still enjoys planting crops, but sometimes the abrupt changes in weather have hurt his production. Moving forward he wants to continue working hard to improve his crops.

This is his third loan with MFP. Miler knows that this funding will be beneficial in the development of his business. He is a responsible member of his Communal Bank, which explains why he is well respected. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more compost to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Devora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Devora está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa Argentina L. Gonzales, coordinadora del grupo quien comercializa zapatos desde hace cuatro años y quien su ella con tener un tramos de calzado. 
Las otras dos integrantes son Yareth L. Delgado tiene un puesto de repuesto de bicicleta en el mercadito y María Cristina L. comercializa bisutería desde hace 4 años. Ellas iniciaron estos negocios con su esfuerzo y desean que progresen por ello solicitan este primer crédito.
texts.en:
The Devora Group consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising women. One of them is Rosa Argentina L. Gonzales, the group coordinator, who has been selling shoes for four years. She has a vending space where she sells shoes.

The other two members are Yareth L. Delgado, who has a small bicycle parts shop at the market, and María Cristina L., who has been selling costume jewelry for four years. They started their businesses as a result of their own efforts and want to keep progressing. This is their first loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Margilita

texts.en:
Margilita B., 51, is from the village of Manaring, Ilagan. She is married and has grown-up children. To make a living, Margilita operates her own manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling charcoal to local businesses and community members. Margilita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Margilita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. The 5000 PHP loan that she is requesting now will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, and it will be Margilita's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to further improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for manufacturing

loans.name: Dinorah Judith

texts.es:
La señora Dinorah Méndez tiene 6 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo para damas, caballeros y niños, gorras, colas para pelo y tambien una gran variedad de ropa interior.
Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la Terminal de transporte de esta ciudad, una de las terminales mas utilizadas por las personas que viajan a diferentes partes del departamento.
El crecimiento de su negocio es notable gracias a la buena administración, la excelente atención a los clientes y a la buena ubicación del mismo.   
Doña Dinorah vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar es comerciante individual posee un carro el cual utiliza para hacer viajes, con su compañero de hogar tienen 3 hijos de los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos y en la actualidad esta esperando otro bebe.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Dinorah Méndez has been a merchant for six years. Her main activity is selling clothes and footwear for women, men, and children. She also sells hats, ponytail accessories, and a great variety of underwear. Her business is located in the city’s transportation terminal. It is one of the terminals most used by people who travel to different parts of the department. The growth of her business is notable thanks to the good administration, the excellent attention to customers, and its good location. Dinorah is in a common-law marriage, and her companion is an individual merchant. He has a car, which he uses to make trips. They have three children who are 100% dependent upon them. She is currently expecting another baby. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise and better stock her business. She needs the income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sandals, belts, billfolds, blouses, shirts, hats, shoes, necklaces, ponytail accessories, and  hairpins

loans.name: Lorence

texts.en:
This is Lorence L., 47, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Ireneo L., an auto electrician, and is the mother of an elementary-aged child. By the grace of God, Lorence has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Lorence, who herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Lorence operates a meat shop where she also sells native milkfish delicacies such as boneless ones, meat-filled ones, and other products of the like. For her meat shop, she buys live pigs from hog-raisers. The pigs are then slaughtered and sold to the immediate community. She has many customers who buy the cut meat and then sell it on their respective market stalls. There are many customers who prefer Lorence’s products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. It is also a little cheaper to buy meat from an independent meat shop than the ones in the market that sometimes use the services of professional slaughterhouses for their meat. The cost of slaughter is added to the final price of the cut meat, and passed along to the customers. Thus, Lorence has many customers who regularly anticipate her meat and processed milkfish. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Lorence is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy live pigs to be slaughtered and sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lorence dreams of being able to give her child a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own market stall someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy live pigs, milkfish in bulk and ingredients for processing

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita N. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Angelita is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business selling clothing & shoe products from a supplier in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. is from the village of Natappian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 57 years old. Arlene is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Arlene raises pigs for fattening and sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) when she sells one of her raised pigs.

In 2008, Arlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. 

Arlene is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other needed supplies. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other needed supplies

loans.name: Estrellas De Atipiri Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Estrellas de Atipiris ya cuenta con 12 ciclos  de antigüedad, es parte del Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón.  Las socias consideran que las reuniones son espacios en los que también aprovechan para compartir en el grupo.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta,  una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.

La señora  Dora es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, con cinco hijos,  las señoras consideraron que era la persona adecuada para el cargo.

Con respecto a su negocio, ella cuenta con un  Restaurant en su mismo domicilio, comenta que el plato que mejor le sale es el “bistec”.  Está en este negocio desde hace un tiempo, cuenta con el apoyo de su cuñado.  Este crédito de $us 200.-, está destinado para la compra de un refrigerador, ella espera que esta compra le facilite la conservación de carne y otros productos que se descomponen con rapidez cuando se encuentra a la temperatura del medio ambiente.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, tenemos: venta de cocinas, restaurant, tiendas de barrio, chofer, pensión
texts.en:
The Estrellas de Atipiris Communal Association has already completed 12 loan cycles. They are part of the Senkata Regional Office. The group is made up of eight people: seven women and one man. The members believe the meetings also provide an opportunity for them to come together as a group. The committee is made up of the president, a treasurer and a secretary.

Mrs Dora is a 42-year-old woman. She is married with five children and the other women considered her to be the most suitable person for the post. With respect to her business, she has a restaurant in her home. She comments that her most successful dish is steak. She has been in this business for some time and she has the support of her brother-in-law. This loan of $200 is to be used for the purchase of a refrigerator. She hopes that this purchase will help her to preserve the meat and other products which spoil quickly when they are at room temperature.

As regards the businesses of the other members of the association, they are: stove selling, a restaurant, neighborhood stores, a driver and a guest house.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Armando Lorenco

texts.pt:
Armando Lourenço L. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de filhos já maiores de idade. Fez somente 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo em missão de serviço, nessa altura veio sozinho. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de refeições e bebidas ha mais de 20 anos, não tem empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos (PROCREDIT), conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, vinho, ovos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

O seu maior sonho é construir uma mercearia. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro crédito para poder realizar seu sonho.
texts.en:
Armando Lourenço L. was born in Manjacaze District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has adult children.  Armando only finished fourth grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties.  He lives in his own house with his family and supports two grandchildren who live with him.

He left Manjacaze to go to Maputo on a work assignment, and at that time he came alone.  For more than 20 years he has had his own business selling meals and drinks.  He has no employees and earns about 5,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses.  He also saves some money in his bank account.

Armando had loans before with other banks (ProCredit).  He learned about Hluvuku through his neighbor, who is also a customer of this institution.  This is Armando's first loan with Hluvuku.  He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (beer, soft drinks, wine, eggs and other items) to increase the amount of stock he has.

His greatest dream is to build a grocery store.  Armando is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another to make his dream come true.

loans.use: Buy products (beer, soft drinks, wine, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man with four children .He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of opening up a boutique for brand new clothing and in the process transforming his second-hand clothing boutique which he is operating. He also dreams of educating his children so that they can have a better future. 

Amos wants a loan to purchase second-hand clothes to sell at his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothes to sell at his shop

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar G. M. tiene 43 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar G. M. is 43 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 7 children.
