Aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos y solidaria la visión que ella tiene es tener una panadería mas grande, poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María is 32 years old and lives with her spouse. She completed freshman year of high school, but left to take care of her younger siblings. María has two children who are currently in school. She lives in Trujillo District, Trujillo Province in La Libertad state.

To support herself financially, María started selling cosmetics seven years ago. At first she assisted with sales, but she was later recommended and began selling on her own. One of María’s female friends encouraged her to join the Luz Divina [Divine Light] Community Bank. As she was seeking capital, she decided to become a member of the bank. She used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase beauty products that were on sale in the catalogue.

With a loan of 1,000 soles [about US $ 350], which will be paid back in six months, María plans to purchase cosmetics to increase her stock. She is community bank secretary and, as such, she is responsible for recording meeting minutes and decisions, tracking absences and late payments, and assisting with archiving documents. María hopes to own her own house and provide a better life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora María Susana, tiene 32 años, actualmente es conviviente, estudió hasta 4to año de secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque tenía que cuidar a sus hermanos pequeños, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender productos cosméticos hace 7 años, primero ayudaba a vender, después la recomendaron e ingresó a vender sola. Una amiga la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” y como quería capital, entonces decidió incorporarse a este Banco y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró los productos de belleza que estaban en oferta en el catalogo.

Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar productos cosméticos para incrementar el stock. En el Banco Comunal, La empresaria tiene el cargo de secretaria cuya función es escribir en el acta lo que se acuerda en las reuniones, llevar el control de las inasistencias y tardanzas y ayudar con el archivo de documentos. La socia sueña con tener una casa propia, y darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (cosmetics)

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 46 year old man who lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He lives with his wife and their son, who helps him with his work as a contractor. Angel also builds cabins and stables. Angel has many years of experience and is very well known in the area. He has very little competition, since most of the contractors in his area moved to Spain to look for better paying jobs. Contractors are in high demand where he lives, so Angel has lots of work, and the prices he can charge have risen substantially due to the lack of contractors in the area.

Angel will use this loan to buy a motorcycle for personal use. He has no negative credit history, according to his credit report.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Thik's Group

texts.en:
Thik H., 38, is married to Sophal CH., 33, and have two children who are currently in school. Sophal is a Khmer style house builder and his income is not steady, so he helps his wife in his spare time. Thik has been selling fruit since 1996 at the market. Thik lacks the capital to purchase more fruit to sell. She has requested a loan of US$400 to purchase more fruit stock. Thik is the leader of a small group of three members, who all live in the Norea Commune, Battambang Province, and have requested the following loans:

1. Sareing R., 47, widowed, who is a vegetable and fruit seller. She requests a loan of US$250 to to help serve her business operation.

2. Lim M., 64, is fruit seller. Lim seeks a loan of US$200 to stock fruits in order to resell.

3. Saraim M., 49, widowed, is dessert seller. Saraim requests a loan of US$200 to purchase more dessert ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit stocks

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mr. Vanna S., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Sophal Thann, 46, live along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for twenty three years and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Two of their children are employed full time and the other four children are in high school.

Vanna has been a motorcycle repairer for fifteen years. He buys spare motorcycle parts from the market in Phnom Penh and sells them at his shop, which is in front of his house. He is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more  spare parts for resale and for repairing motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Kimsean

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsean Y., the 25-year-old mother of a young child, sells food, drinks, wines, and beers that her customers come to consume in her local house. Her husband, Mr. Vet On, 27, is both a goldsmith and a motorcycle taxi driver. They reside in Treal Commune, Kompong Tom Province.

In order to enlarge her business and increase her income to better provide for her family, Kimsean is requesting a loan of $350 to buy more meats and ingredients as well as a cow. She, her husband, her child and her nephew are pictured.

loans.use: To buy more meats and ingredients.

loans.name: Sokhan Chea's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group of five is Mrs. Sokhan C. and all the members live in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhan C. is single. She is a primary teacher who can make a small salary to support herself. In order to improve her living conditions and increase her income, Mrs. Sokhan C. seeks a loan to conduct a souvenir shop.

Mrs. Sokhan C. will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To open a souvenir shop.

loans.name: Raiza

texts.en: Raiza is a mother of four who operates a store selling anything and everything.  She is an entrepreneur and allows her customers to dictate her inventory.  Her loan will build a internal bathroom for her family.  Please help us finance a new bathroom for her family!  Thank you!

loans.use: build a bathroom

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en:
Elenoa P. is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband works as a driver to help meet their family's financial needs.

Meanwhile, Elenoa has 3 years of experience in the agriculture business, and she explains that she sells her crops to the public two days per week. Her typical weekly net cash flow is approximately 400 Tala ($166). Further, she notes that she has received previous loans via SPBD, and that such SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for any loans with traditional banks. She is seeking this particular loan to cover her daily business expenses and to purchase equipment needed for her business.

loans.use: To pay for her business's expenses and to purchase necessary equipment

loans.name: Faanofo

texts.en:
Faanofo L., 26, is married with three children. She has just started in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (about $100). SPBD loans are Faanofo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi R. is 30 years old, and happily married with three children. She lives in Igbo-elerinin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Omowumi sells foodstuffs in her shop and has been in this line of business for over five years. She is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organisation (LAPO). Omowumi needs the loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and a grinding machine

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддину 43 года, женат и имеет 3 детей. Он имеет специальность строителя и занимается строительством и ремонтом частных домов. Для этого он имеет свою строительную бригаду и принимает заказы. Кроме основной работы он занимается откормом скота дома. В этом ему помогает его семья – жена и старшие дети. Мухиддин в течении нескольких недель откармливает а затем вывозит на рынки и продает. Узнав о МикроИнвест Мухиддин решил получить займ и собирается приобрести корм для скота и одного бычка.
texts.en:
Muhiddin is 43 years old, married and has three children. His profession is construction and he builds and repairs single-family homes. He has his own work crew and works on contract. In addition to his regular job, he raises cattle at home, and his wife and his older children assist him. Over the course of several weeks Muhiddin fattens the cattle, then takes them to market to sell them. When he learned of MicroInvest, Muhiddin decided to apply for a loan to buy cattle feed and a bull.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed and a bull

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi is 40 years old and she is a widow with four children. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is a 60 year old woman, married, and the mother of five children. All of them are independent except the last born who is currently in school.

Through hard work, Adwoa provides support for her kids education. She is a food vendor who has sold kenkey in her neighborhood for the past twenty years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. 

With the loan, Adwoa wants to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. As part of her business expansion, Adwoa has added cooked rice and stew to her product line. When asked, she said most of her customers request the rice so she saw it as an opportunity.

She hopes to raise more income to allow her child to enter university. She belongs to the community group called “Eye Adom” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Noem Phany, is 25. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1998 and have two daughters. The eldest daughter is in school and the other one is still young.

Heng has been a full-time employee in a company in Phnom Penh since 2006. His wife has been a farmer since 1998. She grows many kinds of vegetables in her village, such as cucumbers, lemon grass, and ridye gourds. The couple want to repair and put additions on their house to protect it from rainwater but they don’t have the money they need. So Heng is asking for his first loan of $500 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Verónica Maria

texts.es: Verónica Maria B. H. vive en Zaragoza en el departamento de La Libertad. Verónica tiene 25 años de edad es madre soltera de dos niñas Estefany de 10 años de edad y Camila de tan solo 7 meses. Verónica se dedica a la venta de pupusas los días viernes, sábado y domingo posee ganancias de un 46% sobre la venta. Verónica solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas para aumentar su margen de producción al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Veronica Maria Beltran Hernandez lives in Zaragoza in the province of La Libertad. Veronica is 25 years old and is a single mother with two children, Stephanie, 10 years old, and Camilla, seven months old. Veronica sells pupusas on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. She earns a forty-six percent profit on what she sells. Veronica is asking for a loan for supplies to make more papusas. She would like to increase her production forty-six percent, equal to her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun depende de ella.

Elizabeth, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes,  nos comenta que para empezar tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades, empezó con pocos panes y ahora ya tiene un negocio establecido en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, esta muy orgullosa y contenta por haber salido adelante con el apoyo  Manuela Ramos que le ayudo bastante a mejorar su servicio.

En la actualidad continua con la venta de panes y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa a comprar sus panes y  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, levaduras, manteca y mejoradoras, huevos en javas.
Parte del dinero también lo invertirá pagando la inicial de su amazadora eléctrica, herramienta principal para preparar sus panes.

Elizabeth, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada y con el apoyo de su pareja, salieron adelante y hoy se siente con ganas de hacer realidad sus demás sueños y metas que tiene trazada en la vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "Mujeres del Futuro" (Women of the Future) loan group in the Bellavista District of the San Martín department. She is 44 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children, two of whom are still dependent upon her. Elizabeth is in the business of baking and selling bread. To begin her business she had to overcome many obstacles. She began with a few breads and currently runs her established business out of her own house, a comfortable environment for her. She is very proud and content for having moved forward with the support of the Manuela Ramos organization, who helped her considerably to improve her service. She currently continues to sell bread and has a faithful clientele who visit her house daily to buy her breads. It is Elizabeth who personally attends to them with the charisma that defines her. With this 1800-sole ($600) loan, she will buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, eggs, fat and seasonings. She will also use part of the loan to continue payments for her electric oven, the primary tool she uses to prepare her breads. Today, Elizabeth is an empowered woman. With her partner's support, they will move forward with the goal of making the dreams and goals that they have mapped out for their lives a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D., who received no formal education, sells fish in Elmina. Divorced with eight dependents, she is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Agnes has been selling fish since 1997, and her loan will be used to buy more fish for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business for savings and educating the children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Ermine

texts.en: Ermine, 43 years old and married with two children, lives in Warri with her family. She sells air fresheners and insect killers.  She hopes for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more air fresheners to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more air fresheners to selll

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma T., a 44-year-old mother of three children, is also a rice grower.  For 23 years she has worked hard tilling her field under the heat of the sun.  She has never lost hope that someday she will be able to achieve her dream of sending all of her children to college, and to have an established business so that her family can live happily.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  She will use the loan to pay the laborers who help prepare the land and also to start a new business.

She says that she likes CEVI services because they offer very low interest rate loans as well as insurance coverage to all their borrowers.

loans.use: to pay the laborers

loans.name: Felicia María

texts.es:
Felicia María G. S. es una señora de 45 años de edad la cual vive con uno de sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Felicia se dedica a la agricultura, en estos momentos ella se dedica a la siembra de ñame, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente doña Felicia está solicitando un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones), para ampliar su siembra y así ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame. 

Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Con esto desea iniciar un proyecto exitoso que le permita mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Doña Felicia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Mantenimiento y compra de insumos para siembra de ñame

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 31 year old mother of two who runs a grocery store in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has been in this business for five years and hopes to open multiple outlets in the region. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy sacks of potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, and onions. She hopes to improve her living standards and earn more to provide a better life for her family. 

She describes herself as hardworking and determined to educate her two children and mentor them into successful life.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata BÂ est une femme de 20 ans, elle est mariée et a un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU il y a deux ans de cela et y a reçu 4 prêts remboursés sans difficulté. Le crédit qu'elle a consenti ce cycle lui servira à renforcer sa boutique, elle vend du riz, de l’huile, du sucre du lait etc. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
20-year-old Fatoumata Bâ is married with one child. She has received and repaid 4 loans during her 2 years as a member of the Kambeng Doumassou Village Bank. She will use the loan granted during this loan cycle to restock her store; she sells rice, oil, sugar, milk, etc. The generated profits allow her to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey S. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old and single. Rey owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, sugar, candies,salt,soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Rey has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rey joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rey from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: C2690 Abumugisha Group

texts.en:
Osee M. is 47 years old and is married with six children and three dependents with ages between 3 and 14 years. Osee is the president of a group called “Abumugisha” which operates its business in Rwamagana, approximately an hour and a half drive from Rwanda's capital city of Kigali. This group has been successfully managing their pharmacy for the past eight years and are very experienced. They are also very committed, working twelve hour days, six days per week.

The members of this group are requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their pharmacy. They will use the loan to purchase more medicines and supplies, which will result in increasing the number of customers as well as greater sales and profit (hopefully). If successful, they plan to reinvest in their business, pay school fees, and continue to build secure futures for their children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of medicines and supplies

loans.name: Albino

texts.es: El Sr Albino  tiene 30 años de edad, Reside en el  barrio Oriental de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Es propietario de 3 vehiculos los cuales los hace trabajar como taxi, vive en la casa de su madre a la cual acompaña ya que es el hijo menor de la familia, el sr albino vive de la renta de sus vehiculos y piensa seguir juntando dinero e inviertiendo para asi algun dia poder tener una vivienda propia para poder ofrecerle una  vida digna a sus futuros hijos y tener una vejes tranquila.
texts.en:
Albino, 30, lives in the Oriental neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz. He owns three vehicles, which are used as taxis. He lives with his mother in her house as he is the youngest child in the family. He lives from the rent on his vehicles. He is planning to continue gathering together money so that some day he might be able to have his own house. Then he will be able to offer a decent life to his future children and to have a peaceful old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en: Alfonso, 39, has been in a rice farming business since 1986. He manages a 1-hectare farm in Banga, South Cotabato. He is a father of 2 children; the eldest is only 12 years old. He works hard in the farm to sustain his family. Having limited capital, he joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to avail of a loan. He requested a loan of 8,000 Php, enough to buy fertilizers and seeds. This will be helpful to him to continue with his farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L., 36, is a hardworking mom and entrepreneur. She is married to Primo L., a vendor, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband in earning an income so that their family can have a better life. She has been repacking and selling  flavorings and spices for 15 years. She also direct sells ready-to-wear clothes and is into food processing.

Lina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT), a Kiva partner, for more than seven years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 20 times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used all the money she borrowed as additional capital for all her businesses. Her three businesses let her earn a total net profit 16,500 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 19,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and she will buy assorted clothes for her ready-to-wear business.

She dreams that she can have her own property to establish her business and prays that all her children will finish their studies someday and have a better life. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Buying assorted clothes for her ready-to-wear business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 50 años, vive con su hija pequeña de 8 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica al comercio, pero desde hace 2 años vende artículos diversos de uso personal, como ganchos para el cabello, ropa interior, cono de hilo, etc.
Ella lleva su mercadería a las diferentes ferias comerciales que se dan en su localidad, y con esta actividad puede solventar los gastos de su familia.
Para el futuro, desea poder comprar o alquilar un puesto fijo para realizar sus ventas con mayor comodidad.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella ha demostrado con su puntualidad ser una persona de confianza y con ello, el aprecio de sus compañeros en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita se utilizará para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old and lives with her 8-year old daughter in a house she owns. She has dedicated herself to commerce for 4 years, but over the past 2 years has sold a variety of products for personal use such as hairpins, undergarments, spools of thread, etc. She takes her products to the various commercial markets held in her area, and with this activity is able to meet the financial needs of her family. In the future, she hopes to rent a fixed location from which to sell her wares. This is her third opportunity to access credit with MFP, and she has demonstrated with her punctuality that she is a trustworthy person. As such, she has earned the appreciation of the other members in her cooperative bank. The funds she is currently requesting would be used to buy additional merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Aina

texts.en:
Aina sells clothes, shoes and bags in her shop at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for the past two years. She hopes to own a world class boutique in the future.

Aina is single and without children. She hopes to get married soon. She is 32 years old.

Aina hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Aina says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita O. buys coconut wine from Leyte. She then sells the wine and earns Php 200.00 per container, income which really helps her family to purchase adequate supplies of food, clothing and other needs.  Angelita is now requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. which she will use to buy more coconut wine to resell.

loans.use: To buy more coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Khon Chum Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people make up this village bank loan. They are villagers in Boeng Khpob village. Mrs. Khon C. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Besides this, she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Chhou Hieng Sorn, is a construction worker. They have some problems because they have some piglets that are too small to sell. Thus, Mrs. Khon C. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and rest of the loan she would like to buy gasoline and fertilizer for farming. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is an iron welder, and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Mamasydykova Minara`s Group

texts.ru:
Минаре 34 года. Она проживает вместе с мужем и двумя дочерьми. Дети школьники, супруг работает в России. Клиент занимается пошивом на заказ национальных изделий (жакандос, корпо). Ее старшая дочь помогает и учится у мамы кройке и шитью Кредит запрашивается для закупа материи метражом для пошива и реализации.

Маматкуловой Максуде 47 лет. Она также занимается кройкой и шитьем национальных изделий. Имеет свою постоянную клиентуру. Она замужем и мать 3 сыновей. Старшие сыновья работают и помогают семейному бюджету. Младший сын школьник. Кредит запрашивается для закупа материи

Зуура, 32, замужем. Ее супруг занимается частным извозом по городу Ноокат. У нее 5 детей. На кредит планируют купить дойную корову, для обеспечения семьи молочными продуктами. Кроме этого они выращивают картофель. 

Гулбарчыну 28 лет. Она также замужем, ее супруг занимается перепродажей скота. Бизнес они начали с покупки двух коз. На данное время увеличили поголовье скота -у них имеется 6 овец, 1 корова. Кредит запрашивается для закупа МРС


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Minara is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters. The children go to school, and the husband works in Russia. Minara is involved in sewing national goods (jakandos, korpo) to-order. Her oldest daughter helps her and learns tailoring and sewing from her mother. Minara is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric for sewing and sale. Maksuda Mamtkulova is 47 years old. She is also involved in tailoring and sewing of national goods. She has a loyal customer base. Maksuda is married and is a mother of 3 sons. The oldest sons work and help with the family budget. The youngest son goes to school. Maksuda is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric. Zuura is 32 years old, married. Her husband provides transportation services in the city of Nookat. Zuura has 5 children. They plan to use the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to provide the family with milk products. They also grow potatoes. Gulbarchyn is 28 years old. She is also married. Her husband is involved in livestock sales. They started this business with a purchase of two goats. Since then, they increased livestock headcount to 6 sheep and one cow. They are requesting the loan for the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene tiene 30 años, es soltera y madre de una pequeña hija, juntas viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un poblado de Ayacucho. A Rene siempre le ha gustado progresar y desde muy niña le gustaba ayudar a su familia en la  venta de frutas. Ahora produce y comercializa sus productos como: frutas cítricas, papaya, plátano y mango; siendo estos vendidos en su comunidad, pero generalmente los lleva a la ciudad de Ayacucho para su vetna a los mayoristas, dejándolo a buen precio. Ella recibe la ayuda de sus padres en tiempo de siembra y cosecha. En el futuro piensa invertir en una tienda de venta de ropa, en donde pueda ofrecer una gama de cualidades y variedades de prendas de vestir, además de variados precios de acuerdo a la economía de sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además desea continuar perteneciendo a su grupo comunal, por ser un grupo bien organizado. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en insumos y abono para su terreno de cultivo, de esa manera minimizar los riesgos de plagas que afecten sus productos.
texts.en:
Rene is 30 years old. She is a single mother of a young daughter and lives in her own house located in Ayacucho. Rene always enjoys making progress and has been selling fruits with the help of her family since she was a girl. She now produces and sells products such as citrus fruits, papayas, bananas, and mangos. These fruits are sold in her community, but she generally takes her produce to the city of Ayacucho to sell to wholesalers at a good price. Her parents help her during the planting and harvesting seasons. In the future, she wants to open a clothing store where she can offer a range of outfits that vary in quality and price based on what her customers can afford.

This is her second loan with MFP. She commits to meeting her payment obligations and also wants to continue participating in her Communal Bank, which is a well-organized group. With the loan she requested, Rene will invest the funds in supplies and compost for her farmland. The will minimize the risk of plagues that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & compost

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia L. is persistent in pursuing her dream of growing her taho (sweet tofu-based snack) vending business. Despite the difficulty in maintaining her business as she cannot re-invest her business income into it as it is also the main income source for her family's daily expenses, Anecia is hopeful that some day her dream will be ground on the palm of her hand. With that, she wants to request a much larger loan to support her business's needs and at the same time to sustain its operation. With her passion for giving her children a better future and a decent kind of life, she will be willing to work hard and to help her husband’s sporadic income as a taho vendor.

As a mother, Anecia’s dreams are always for her children and family. She wants to improve her children's quality of life. In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hoped to have secured access to capital for the continuation of her taho vending business. Her previous loans were carefully utilized as additional and rolling capital for her business. 

Anecia is hopeful that her business will grow and that some day she will have more customers around the village. She also dreams of sending all her children to school until college and that they find good jobs. One of her aspirations is to be able to build a house that is durable and spacious.

loans.use: To support her business's needs and to sustain its operation

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of Garang Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Elena is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates an agricultural business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily K. makes a living by selling tea and bread in a restaurant, and has applied for this loan to buy new supplies of sugar and milk. Lily is 28 years old and married to an electrician. She has one child who does not yet go to school. With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of sugar and milk

loans.name: Chhorng

texts.en:
Chhorng C., 64, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. C. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD 5 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase fertilizers and a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C. appears in the photograph with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and a motorbike

loans.name: Griselda Milagros

texts.es:
Griselda es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a sus hijas en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona de bastante mivimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta y distribución de prendas de vestir en base a pedidos, ella adquiere su mercadería al por mayor en la ciudad de Trujillo y luego la ofrece en venta a sus clientes y vecinos, mayoritariamente ella trabaja en base a pedidos. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad Griselda es muy conocida en el rubro y ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.

Griselda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas de vestir, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Griselda ya es una clienta recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, durante todo este tiempo ella se ha venido ayudando de Nuestra Empresa para salir adelante, demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Griselda is a 31 year old mother who lives with her daughters in the farming district of Chepén, an area that experiences considerable business movement and belongs to the province of the same name. This community is located in the region of La Libertad, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For the past five years, Griselda has been selling and distributing articles of clothing according to her orders. She acquires her merchandise in bulk in the city of Trujillo and then offers her products for sale to her customers and neighbors. Most of her work is based on orders. Since she has been in this business for some time, Griselda is well-known and has acquired a group of loyal customers.

Griselda wants to expand her business by purchasing more articles of clothing, which will help her increase her sales and attract more business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can accomplish this goal.

Griselda is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa. During the time she has received assistance from the Institution, she has succeeded in being prompt and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Cesar Vallejo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito más poblado de la región Lambayeque, es también el distrito con mayores índices de pobreza, debido a que la mayor parte de su población reside en zonas urbano – marginales. Se encuentra situado cerca a la ciudad de Chiclayo, a diez minutos de la plaza central de la ciudad de Chiclayo,

Se dedica a la comercialización de verduras en el mercado Atusparias, este centro de abastos es uno de los mas importantes de su distrito, ella cuenta con una clientela fiel que siempre acude a su puesto de venta para solicitar verduras frecas y en buenas condiciones, para poder mantenerse en el rubro ella trata de brindar los mejores productos con una buena atención a sus clientes.

Gladys desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Gladys es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo la conideran una mujer de confianza y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year-old mother that lives with her family in the Cesar Vallejo sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the most populated district of the Lambayeque region. This is also the district with the most poverty, due to the fact that most of its population resides in marginal urban zones. It is located close to the city of Chiclayo, ten minutes from the central plaza of the city of Chiclayo, Fladys is dedicated to the commercialization of vegetables in the Atusparias market. This center of supplies is one of the most important of her district. She relies on a faithful clientele that always frequent her sales position to request fresh vegetables in good condition. To maintain her business in the area she tries to offer the best products with good attention to her clients. Gladys desires to expand her business with the purchase of more products, so that she can expand her sales and receive more income that will permit her to improve her family's situation. To achieve her objective she has requested a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. Gladys is a hard-working and enterprising woman. Her neighbors and coworkers consider her a trustworthy woman and quite responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to grow her business

loans.name: Khairidin

texts.en:
Khairidin A. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has 4 children, the elder is studying at University and his youngest is still in elementary school. Khairidin began a small grocery store 5 years ago with his savings. He was assisted by his wife, who helps him to serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Khairidin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and maize at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and millet to sell. Jane is 29 years old and married to a nurse. She has two children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans and millet to sell

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina M. lives in the lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She has no additional family members.  She has a business of operating a bar.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home at retail prices. The main business challenges for Madina include seasonality. 

Madina has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy crates of beer and soda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar.  

She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by acquiring additional capital.  Madina lives in a home that she rents and has access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: T o buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling chicken legs, chicken wings, and other chicken meat in the market. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $120 a month for these activities.

In 2003, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 8th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita G. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Marianita is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marianita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marianita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marianita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marianita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y  reside junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de carne de pollo, ella adquiere este producto al por mayor y lo vende en su domicilio. Asimismo lo distribuye en las principales bodegas de la zona. El negocio tiene mucha acogida debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando y al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella se encarga de apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Genara desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante activa y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia desarrollarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Genara, 43, is married and lives with her husband and a son in the agricultural Tambogrande district which is part of Piura province, Piura region, located over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

She is a chicken retailer.  She buys the chicken at wholesale and sells it from home.  She also sells to the main stores in her area.  The business is quite well received because of the time she’s been in operation and the good customer service she provides.  Income from it allows her to help her husband support the household.

Genara wants to enlarge the business buying more merchandise in order to meet customer demand.  She is, therefore, asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal.

She is quite an active and enterprising woman.  Her greatest wish is to see her family develop and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 36 años, casada y madre de tres hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Tras el viaje de su tía al extranjero, se le abrió las puertas al negocio. Desde entonces se dedica a la venta de aretes y collares artesanales. Por ello espera cada fin de mes, para recibir el pedido de sus clientes, hasta alcanzar el kilo exacto en aretes y collares de fantasía para que le puedan hacer llegar tal requerimiento. Es así que viene trabajando hace dos años en esta actividad, siendo su trabajo la recolección de pedidos de estas joyas artesanales, por lo que lo considera tranquilo y rentable su trabajo. En adelante, piensa poner su tienda de joyas, para abarcar otros mercados, además de las artesanías.Es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir pagando como hasta ahora de manera puntual. En su banco comunal es un clienta muy activa y comprometida con las reuniones. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar fantasía de alpaca que son utilizadas para la elaboración de aretes, collares y pulseras, y poder enviar el pedido pendiente que tiene.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She and her family live in their own home. After her aunt took a trip abroad, Maritza opened the doors of her business. Since then, she has sold handcrafted earrings and necklaces. At the end of each month, she waits to receive orders from her customers so that she will know to the exact kilo how much wool she needs to buy to make the earrings and necklaces. Maritza has been working in this business for two years. She chose to make jewelry as her line of work because she considers it to be peaceful and profitable. In the future, she plans to open a jewelry store and sell at the other markets and craft fairs.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP. Maritza promises to continue submitting her payments in a prompt manner. She is one of most active and committed members at her Communal Bank meetings. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy the “Fantasia” brand of alpaca wool for making earrings, necklaces, and bracelets so that she can complete her outstanding orders.

loans.use: Purchase alpaca wool & metal used in producing her handmade jewelry

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Abibatu F.. She is married, and has two children aged two and four years. In 1990, Abibatu established her ladies' slippers and sandals business. She began her business because she believed the business could be a means of generating income to sustain her family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,350,000 SLL every month from this business.

Abibatu requires a loan of 4,500,000 SLL in order to expand her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL.

In the future, Abibatu plans to open a bigger shop and support her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more ladies slippers and sandals.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando, se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de molino. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. El siempre ha demostrado ser una persona muy tranquila y trabajadora la mayoría de clientes de Orlando le solicitan este servicio porque es muy solicitado para moler maíz, pinol, pinolillo entre otras cosas. Es una persona muy emprendedora y tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en: Sr. Orlando has a business in which he provides milling services.  This is not the first time he has accessed a loan.  He has always demonstrated that he is a peaceful and hardworking individual.  Most of Orlando’s customers request his services because they need to grind corn for making “pinol”, “pinolillo” (both are traditional beverages made with cornmeal), and other items.  He is an enterprising person who has all the desire to succeed.

loans.use: Operating capital for providing milling services

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 37 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio de 42 años y sus 5 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Julia en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, el cacao, café y hojas de coca que cultiva, están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Julia is 37 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 42 year-old Antonio, and her five dependent children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.  Julia's long days working on her land have helped her become a very knowledgeable farmer, growing cacao, coffee and coca leaves.  She looks after her crops very well and always fetches a good price for them when she comes to sell them.  What she most likes about her work is cultivating her land since this is something she has done since she was a girl.  She has been doing this for 30 years and she considers that that hardest part of her work is transporting her products to the market in the city of San Francisco.

Over time, Julia hopes to buy more land and thereby increase her production.  This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is saving so that she will be able to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank.  She feels very happy as a member of her bank.  Julia will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy manure and insecticides so that she can care for her land.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Chauv

texts.en:
Chauv R. is a woman of 24 years who has a life partner in her husband who works as a butcher in his village, earning about 3.30 USD each day. Chauv and her husband have one lovely child (see photo).

Chauv has a small shop in Chey Moulkol village, Kompong Tom Province. She sells a few products such as beef, pork, cooking ingredients, water and fast food as well as rice. As Chauv’s business is operating successfully, she would like to purchase more items to sell such as water and other necessary products. This is why she is requesting a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited, Kiva’s field partner.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Jessica Esperanza

texts.es: Jessica Esperanza tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y repostería. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio, inicio este medio de vida con mucho esfuerzo pues ha sido muy difícil mantener activo ambas actividades. Ella es una joven muy luchadora que disfruta de conversar con sus clientes. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que siempre está pendiente de brindarles lo más necesarios.  El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, pantalones, trajes y también para ciertos productos de repostería.
texts.en:
Jessica Esperanza is 40 years old and has been selling clothing and bakery products for over 12 years.  She had a difficult time setting up the businesses and now struggles to keep both active.  She is a hard worker and enjoys talking to her customers.

She has three minor children and is always trying to provide the best for them.  The loan she is requesting is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and ingredients for her bakery products.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge Luis V. M. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Operador de Pozo  tiene  diez  años  de trabajar para esta institución es acompañado actualmente, tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  Seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Jorge Luis V. M. is an active worker in the business of "Enacal San Rafael del Sur". He works as a well operator. He has been working for this institution for 10 years. He is currently in a relationship. He has two children who are of school age. He has had six loans through CEPRODEL and each one has helped him to buy construction materials like sand, cement, rocks, stones, blocks, etc. to enlarge and improve his house. The loans with CEPRODEL have helped him in a great way since in this way he has improved his family's way of life.

loans.use: Sand, Cement, Rocks, Stones, Blocks

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 20 years old and married with one child who is one year old. She is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya, where she has been farming for three years. Her mixed farm produces eggs, vegetables and tomatoes which are sold at the local market. 

Anne has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to expand her business and save for the education of her children. She would like to buy at least four dairy cows and a chuff cutter in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Emmanuel S.

texts.en:
Here is 42-year-old Emmanuel S. G., a small scale businessman in Mile Ninety One, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Emmanuel owns a shop that sells drinks, a business he has been operating for 10 years now. With a loan of SLL 3,000,000, he will buy crates of drinks to add to his business.

A native of Matotoka village, Emmanuel, is married to a business woman and the couple has four children who all attend primary school. Emmanuel will be the second Kiva borrower from the town of Mile Ninety One.

loans.use: To buy crates of drinks for his business

loans.name: Dianne Diony

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dioni; la socia tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cámaras digitales ella viaja hasta Bolivia para comprar mercadería y así poder vender a sus clientes que tiene, ella trabaja de forma independiente repartiendo las cámaras digitales a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para así poder ofrecer a más clientes y de esta manera tener más ganancia.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Dianne is a member of the community bank “COMUZONE III” in Cusco.  She is 27 and has 2 children.  Dianne divides her time between the daily tasks buying and selling digital cameras for which she travels to Bolivia to purchase.  She works independently delivering products to clients who order them.  Dianne is a joyful person with great aspirations.  She seeks a loan to buy inventory for his business in order to increase profits, and is committed to prompt repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger inventory of digital cameras to increase sales

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Sara Esther le está haciendo falta los acabados y pintar la portes del exterior, también quiere colocar un portón  de herrería la frente de su casa para tener mayor seguridad. Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. 
Desea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en el aria de producción, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene un hijo  bajo su responsabilidad, y quiere que tenga la educación necesaria y que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
The exterior of Sara Esther's house is unfinished, and the doors need to be painted.  It also needs an iron gate at the front to provide greater security.  She is seeking this loan to buy the necessary material and to pay someone to do this improvement work.

She will pay off the loan with part of the money she earns from working in a production factory, which is her source of income, since she is a single mother and has a young son whom she wants to keep in school.

loans.use: to put an iron gate in front of her house and to finish off the exterior.

loans.name: Esnas

texts.en:
Esnas is a single mother of one child, who attends school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation costs. For the past six years, she has operated a hand bag business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a beauty salon, and sells shoes and clothes for another source of income. 

Esnas's business has improved greatly and she now dreams of selling at wholesale in the future. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of hand bags for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of hand bags for sale.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana, de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora, está casada con Gregorio, de 35 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son menores y estudian, como una familia unidad ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara.

“Hace 20 años que me dedico, a sembrar; pero pareciera que fue ayer”, afirma. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos, en los que pasa la mayor parte del día, sus principales cultivos son de papa en sus diferentes variedades. Aquella sonrisa que le caracteriza, le ayuda, en la comercialización de sus productos en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”, sus clientes, le ofrecen buen precio por su producción; gracias a su buena disposición en el momento de la venta. Pero lo que le disgusta de la siembra es cuando, la rancha y gusanera se apodarán de los tubérculos, lo que a veces le ocasiona grandes pérdidas, pero eso no la desanida y para más adelante quiere comparar sus propios terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera minimizar costos de inversión. Su principal preocupación son los gastos de estudio de sus hijos; en donde invierte la mayor parte de sus ganancias. Pero gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal; puede emprender no solo sus proyectos también brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP; donde agradece por todo este tiempo que; gracias al apoyo de su asociación. Pudo sembrar.

Viviana; sembró hace muy poco papa de la variedad “yungay”. Por ello con el dinero del préstamo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos y de esa manera obtener una buena cosecha en el mes de setiembre.
texts.en:
Viviana, 35, is a hard working woman married to Gregorio, 35.  They have five children four of whom are minors and studying.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Santa Clara.

“I’ve been a farmer for 20 years but it seems as if it was just yesterday,” she affirms.  Her life is centered on caring for her fields where she spends most of the day.  Her main crops are different varieties of potato.  That characteristic smile of hers helps her to sell her products in Tarma’s central market.  Her customers pay a good price for her products thanks to her pleasant disposition at the moment of the sale.

What she dislikes about farming is when the insect and worm plagues attack the tubers which occasionally causes large losses.  However, she doesn’t become discouraged and later on wants to buy her own fields so that she can lessen her investment costs.

Her main worry is her children’s educational expenses which is where she invests most of her profits.  But thanks to support from her communal bank she can undertake not only her businesses but also provide a better quality of life for her children.

She’s a member of the “Trabajemos Unidos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank and this is the ninth loan with MFP where she is grateful for all this time which, thanks to support from her association, she was able to plant.

Viviana planted “Yungay” variety of potatoes recently so will use the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among her crops to obtain a good harvest in September.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 57 años, enviudó hace 20 años, a pesar de los constantes problemas económicos, cuidó con mucho esmero de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos y su pequeño nieto, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Vista Hermosa. Recuerda con mucho cariño a su esposo, quien después de su muerte la dejó amparada. Cobrando una pensión mensual de S/. 300 nuevos soles, gracias al trabajo arduo que realizó su esposo en una hacienda. Gracias al apoyo conjunto y la buena coordinación de su familia y conocidos, logró obtener una casa en la ciudad de Chanchamayo, y otra en la ciudad de Tarma, donde ahora se dedica a alquilar las habitaciones, por lo que solo vive de las rentas que le proporciona dicho alquiler. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es “la tranquilidad”, ya que no realiza trabajos físicos, que por la edad que tiene no puede realizarlos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener buenos resultados, pues le agrada la dedicación de su entidad por el bienestar de los demás. Hace poco la casa de Julia sufrió un derrumbe en la parte frontal; producto de la humedad, por ello con el crédito, invertirá en la construcción de una pared más segura.
texts.en:
Julia, age 57, became a widow 20 years ago.  Despite constant economic problems, she was able to take good care of her seven children.  She lives with two of them and her small grandson in her own house in the rural area of Vista Hermosa.  She remembers her husband with affection.  Following his death she was taken care of with a monthly pension of 300 PEN thanks to the hard work he carried out on the farm.  Because they worked hard together and in good coordination with family and acquaintances, she was able to buy a house in the city of Chanchamayo and another in the city of Tarma, where she rents out rooms.  Her income is what she receives from the rental business.

What she likes best about her work is the "tranquility" because she doesn't have to do physical labor, which she couldn't do because of her age.  This is her first loan through MFP and she hopes to obtain good results.  She likes the institution's dedication toward quality of life for others.  Not too long ago the front of Julia's house fell down as a result of humidity.  She plans to use the loan to build a safer wall.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the front wall of her house.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Piedad tiene 59 años, vive con su hija y su nieta en su casa propia. Siempre se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas, con el paso D. los años obtuvo un trabajo dependiente en la municipalidad distrital D. su localidad, en donD. pasa la mayor parte D. su tiempo. Su hija es quien la ayuda en el cuidado D. los cuyes y gallinas que posee, y durante los fines D. semana los venD. y otro tanto lo usa para su consumo propio. Ella le gusta mucho el comercio D. animales menores, es así que los compra al por mayor y a un precio menor. D. esta manera se genera más ganancias, es por eso que ahora desea incrementar la cantidad D. animales que tiene. Este será su crédito número 11 con MFP,  esta muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal ya que através D. los años ha llegado a conocer a los integrantes D. su grupo comunal, por quienes considera como gente D. confiar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar abono para sembrar maíz
texts.en:
Piedad, 59, lives with her daughter and granddaughter in her own house.  She has always been a farmer.  In time, she got a salaried job working for her local district municipality where she now spends most of her time.  Her daughter helps her care for the guinea pigs and chickens she has and on weekends she sells them and uses some of them for their own consumption.  She likes small animal commerce very much; she buys them at wholesale at a lower price.  This way she earns higher profits and this is why she now wants to increase the number of animals she has.

This will be loan #11 with MFP.  She is very happy to be part of her communal bank because throughout the years she has gotten to know the members well and considers them to be trustworthy people.

She will use the requested loan to buy manure to plant corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her welding shop business.

Lina has been in this business for 20 years. Lina earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to  afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her welding shop

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s tandoor (a kind of stove made with mud, burning wood, used to make bread). His tandoor is located in the community and he gets good income on a regular basis.  He sells each flatbread for Pak rupees 5 which is almost the same everywhere. His bread quality is very good and he uses good quality flour for making bread.  

With the loan, he will buy flour and wood to be able to fill the customers’ orders on time and generate more income. 

Shamim herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities, staying at home. She is hopeful that the loan investment will prove a productive one for him.

loans.use: To buy flour & wood for bread-making & selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias, tomates, cebollas y pepinos, ella vende en el mercado desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como zanahorias, pepinos, cebollas, tomates y papas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurial Women) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 48 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, onions and cucumbers.  She makes her sales in the market from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this small business, she gets her children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to expand her vegetable business.  She is requesting a loan to buy carrots, cucumbers, onions, tomatoes and potatoes.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as carrots, cucumbers, onions, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Kweyamba Women's Namawojolo Group
