Her family needed to enlarge their house, and since they own the land where the house is constructed, they started building an extension. The family together is contributing to cover the expenses, so Thekrayat came to FATEN and took a $1,500 loan which is the amount they need to cover the last expenses.

Thekrayat's brother appears in the picture here as she is not comfortable with having her picture published.

loans.use: Building a house extension

loans.name: Rafael Fernando

texts.es: Rafael Fernando V. H. de 25 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable con su familia. Él posee un ciber café, en el cual brinda el servicio de Internet y así mismo comercializa otros artículos como: cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, diferentes tipos de papelería, CD’s y otros más. En el negocio le ayuda su esposa, de modo que ambos trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, junto a quien residen en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Rafael solicita un préstamo con el deseo de mejorar su servicio, comprando productos como: audífonos, cámaras web, nuevos monitores, parlantes y otros accesorios muy útiles y necesarios para las computadoras que él alquila. De esta forma Rafael desea ir creciendo más y más y así contar con un negocio muy estable, el cual le brinde una mejor estabilidad económica para él y su familia.
texts.en: Rafael Fernando V. H. is 25 years old. He is a very hard-working young man who is responsible for his family.  He owns a cyber café in which he offers Internet services and sells other articles such as notebooks, pencils, pens, various types of stationery, CD’s and other items.  His wife helps him in the business and they both work very hard so that their young two-year-old son will get ahead in life.  They live in the department of Ahuachapán.  Rafael is requesting this loan because he wants to improve his service.  He plans to buy headphones, web cams, new monitors, speakers, and other useful and necessary accessories for the computers which he rents out.  In this way, Rafael wants to continue growing his business so that it will become stable and provide better financial stability for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos trabaja como chofer desde hace mas de 10 años tiene auto propio y vive en domicilio familiar en la zona de Arocagua, actualmente su esposa se encuentra en España se fue a buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo tiene un solo hijo necesita el crédito para la compra de repuestos de su automóvil ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un buen servicio a sus clientes,  es nuevo en la institución y con el crédito kiva, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan Carlos has been a driver for more than 10 years. He has his own car and he lives in a family neighborhood in the region of Aocagua. His wife is currently in Spain. She went in search of better work opportunities. They only have one son. He requires the loan to purchase spare parts for his car as it is experiencing some malfunctions and it is interfering with the services he provides. He is a new member in the group and to the Kiva program. He is very grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul S. is 41 years old and married with three children who are all in school. He lives in Ibanda and is involved in the sale of bananas from Akebumba village. Paul also has a produce store in the same area from which he sells such products as sugar cane, tomatoes and coffee. He is able to make 360,000 UGX from his monthly sales.

Paul is requesting a loan so he can expand his produce business. He first grew tomatoes, then started selling bananas as well. Paul is a hardworking and cooperative man. His dream is to expand his business further as well as educating his children.

loans.use: To expand his business by growing more tomatoes and buying more bananas for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 31 años, convive con William, de 37 años. Ambos tienen una hermosa hija; Claudia, de 15 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Palca. El trabajo al que se dedica, está hermosa mujer; es la venta de flores en las variedades de gladiolo, alhelí e iris; los que compra al por mayor y menor, para luego revenderlos en la capital a los intermediarios que distribuyen las flores en todo el país. Las épocas donde vende más son los días festivos como: día de la madre, navidad, año nuevo. Pues según afirma ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a ello, donde genera un promedio de mil a 2 mil nuevos soles en ganancias al mes, producto de los viajes que realiza 3 veces a la semana. Por ello más adelante quiere comenzar con los papeles necesarios para poder exportar las hermosas flores que crecen en Perú, con ello piensa mejorar sus ingresos y por ende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es el segundo crédito con MFP, y se siente dichosa por todo el apoyo que recibe en su banco comunal, donde cada día aprende a progresar y salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más flores, para llevar a vender a la capital, donde podrá aumentar su capital.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old.  She lives with her partner, 37 year-old William.  They both have a beautiful daughter, 15 year-old Claudia.  They live together as a family in her parents' house which is in the town of Palca.  This beautiful woman's business is selling flowers.  She sells gladioli, wallflowers and irises.  She buys them both wholesale and retail and then re-sells them in the capital to middlemen who distribute them all over the country.

The periods when Gloria sells the most flowers are holidays such as Mother's Day, Christmas and New Year.  She says that she has been in this business for 2 years and she makes on average 1,000 to 2,000 Peruvian soles profit a month as a result of the trips which she makes three times a week.  For this reason, in the future she would like to start getting together the necessary paperwork which will enable her to export the beautiful flowers that grow in Peru.  In this way she plans to improve her income and, consequently, enjoy a better quality of life.

This is Gloria's second loan with MFP and she feels fortunate for the support that she has received from her community bank where every day she learns to make progress and get ahead.  She will use her loan to buy more flowers to take and sell in the capital city where she will be able to increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy more flowers wholesale to take to the capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To look after the health of her crops

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix R. N. de 33 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, en el departamento de Cabañas. Él vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a 5 hijos todos menores de edad. Félix se dedica a la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz, los cuales comercializa en su hogar, así mismo posee un molino el cual alquila a diferentes personas. Félix es un padre de familia muy responsable quien se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar un molino más, de esta forma él espera poder atender a más clientes, con lo cual cuente con más ganancias, las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su hogar y sus cinco hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar.
texts.en:
Félix R. N. is 33 years old and lives in Sensuntepeque, in Cabañas department.  He lives together with his wife, who takes care of the household chores, and his 5 dependent children.

Félix's business is in basic grains such as rice, beans and corn which he sells from his home.  He also owns a mill which he rents out to different people.  Félix is a very responsible father who works hard to get ahead in life.  He is requesting this loan to buy another mill.  In this way, he hopes to be able to serve more customers which will make him more profits.  These profits will be very helpful for his household and his 5 children who are studying.

loans.use: To buy a mill to improve his service

loans.name: Poeng's Group

texts.en:
In Prey SnuO. village in Takeo province, there are twelve people joining together for a bank loan. Mrs. Poeng S. has been selected by the other members to be the leader.  They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their families'  living. 
Poeng S. is a pig breeder who  earns money to support her famiL. while her husband, Mr. Sim Thean, is a laborer and basket maker.  Since her business is going well,  Poeng S. wants to expand.  She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets, and also for rice for eating. She is a mother of a child who is attending the local public schoO..

loans.use: To buy more piglets, and to buy rice for eating.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José tiene su negocio que es la venta de leña. Hace más 20 años que tiene este negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar ya que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que tiene que hacerse cargo. Inicio por su Papa que le enseño a sobrevivir con este negocio, ya que la mayoría de los hogares no tiene muchos recursos para comprar gas y la leña que es necesaria. El financiamiento es para la compra de leña que es necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en: Carlos José has his own business selling firewood. He has run the business for over 20 years. He has always liked working and especially because he has a young dependent child. He started out thanks to his dad, who taught him to survive with this business. Most homes do not have the resources to buy gas and firewood is a necessity. This loan will be used to buy firewood, which is essential for his business.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar G. est un jeune habitant de Baye laye. Il est âgé de 33 ans. Il a d’abord été chauffeur  de clando avant de se lancer dans le commerce depuis un an. Il se sert de sa voiture, achète  des marchandises  et fait  des placements auprès de ses clients.  Son choix a été surtout motivé par l’aspect rentable de l’activité. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis juillet 2004. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur dans l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de parfums qui seront destinés à la vente. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr Matar G. is a young inhabitant of Baye Laye. 
He is 33 years old. 
He has initially been driver of unregistered taxi before launching out in the trade for one year.
 He makes use of his car, buys goods and transports them to his customers. 
This choice was especially justified by the profitable aspect of the activity. He is member of Baye Laye credit union since July 2004. He already refunded a former loan in the institution. He requests a credit of 150,000 frs envisaged for the purchase of perfumes which will be intended for resale. This financing will enable him to better develop his trade.

loans.use: augmentation de fond

loans.name: Alexandra Moncerrate

texts.es:
Alexandra de 45 años, tiene una papelería surtida con ventas de ropa. Vive en  Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Decidió tener un local para tener su propio negocio, debido a la demanda de papelería la surtió y compro papeles, cuadernos, plumas etc. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatos, pantalones, papelería para surtir más su negocio. En el futuro quiere que su negocio este bien surtido y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 45 and has an office supply store that is also stocked with various clothing items.  She lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (an area on the outskirts of the city that has dirt roads and hills).

She decided to have a location to have her own business due to the demand for office supplies.  She bought paper, noteboks, pens, etc. Currently she works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  With this loan, she will buy shoes, pants, and office supplies to stock her business.  In the future, she wants to have her business be well-supplied and to finish constructing her house.

loans.use: Shoes and office supplies

loans.name: Mauricio Armando

texts.es:
Mauricio de 32 años de edad, reside en El Triunfo departamento de Usulután, vive con su madre y es soltero, posee una panadería, la tienen ubicada en su propia casa, inicio hace 3 años en su propia panadería aunque tiene 14 años de experiencia, su horario es de 4:00am a 1:00pm.
Por el momento necesita comprar harina suave, harina fuerte, azúcar, manteca, gas, azúcar, para esta compra solicita un préstamo y poder solventar esta situación;  Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener un nivel de materiales adecuado para la producción de pan.
Fortalecer  la panadería es el principal objetivo y brindar producto de calidad y buen sabor a los clientes, con estos objetivos espera ir mejorando la condición económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
32 year-old Mauricio lives in El Triunfo, in Usulután department.  He is single and lives with his mother.  Mauricio owns a bakery which is located in his home.  He set up his bakery 3 years ago but he has 14 years experience in this trade.  His working hours are from 4.00am to 1.00pm.

Mauricio currently needs to buy plain flour, self-rising flour, sugar, butter and gas.  He is requesting a loan to buy these products.  This investment will help him to maintain an adequate level of materials for making his bread.

Mauricio's main goal is to strengthen his bakery and provide good-tasting, good-quality products to his customers.  With these goals he hopes to continue improving his household's financial position.

loans.use: to buy plain flour, self-rising flour, sugar, butter and gas

loans.name: Ala Fereti

texts.en:
Ala owns & operates a business driving a taxi.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Ala needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase parts for the vehicle, such as tires, paints and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Ala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ala's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase parts for vehicle, such as tires, paint and equipment.

loans.name: Paul Njoroge

texts.en:
Paul has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 14 years.  He is 40 years old, married to Joyce Mugure, and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy sheep which he will rear for wool production.

In future, Paul hopes to become a leading supplier of wool in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy sheep to rear for wool production.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

En este lugar conocimos a Carlos Julio, tiene 23 años de edad, está soltero, el es de la provincia del Guayas pero por trabajo  hace algunos años se vino a Portoviejo, en la actualidad  vive en la casa de su hermana, allí viven cinco personas con él.

El se  dedica  a trabajar en albañilería y cada dia ha ido mejorando tanto sus conocimientos en esta materia como en las herramientas para realizar un mejor trabajo en menos tiempo, dice que los Ing. Civiles que lo conocen le dan sus obras para que él se las construya ya que además de saber lo que hace es muy responsable, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sabados hasta las 12h00, con el trabajan cuatro personas a quienes les paga un sueldo.

Este crédito para comprar una concretara para realizar un mejor trabajo. Este es el cuarto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy agradecido porque gracias a los crédito ha podido ir mejorando su forma de trabajar.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia empresa de construcción.
texts.en:
The “Río de Oro” (River of Gold) communal bank meets every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Carlos Julio, 23, here.  He’s single and is from the Guayas Province but came to Portoviejo several years ago for work.  He currently lives in his sister’s house and five other people live there with him.

He works as a bricklayer and every day both his skills and his work tools have been improving in order to do better work in less time.  He says that the civil engineers that know him give him their jobs to do because, besides being knowledgeable, he’s very responsible.  He works from Monday through Friday from 8am until 6pm and on Saturdays until noon.  He has four employees that work with him and that he pays a salary to.

This loan is to buy a cement mixer to do a better job.  This is the fourth cycle in the communal bank and he is very grateful because thanks to the loans he’s been able to improve his way of working.  His dream is to have his own construction firm.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 40 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus 05 hijos en casa propia, su vivienda esta ubicada en el Distrito D. TambogranD., cuenta con servicio D. luz eléctrica pero no con agua ni desagüe.

Su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas percibiendo ingresos que aporta al sostenimiento del hogar y la  actividad que desarrolla Victoria es la crianza y venta D. ovinos, ella los cría en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior D. su domicilio. Una vez que los engorda los comercializa en el mercado local.  Esta actividad la realizan desD. hace más D. 3 años, en los que ha podido obtener clientela fija y experiencia en este negocio.

Victoria desea comprar alimento balanceado para que sus ovejas logren el peso ideal y también quiere hacer mejoras en corral D. estos. D. esta manera ampliara sus negocio incrementando el número D. animales que actualmente tiene y por enD. aumentar sus ventas, por eso esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para que pueda alcanzar sus metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and she lives with her husband and their 5 children in a house of their own. Their house is located in the district of TambogranD. and it is equipped with electricity but not with running water or sewage services.

Her husband is an agriculturist and he earns and income to support the home. Victoria's business is to raise and sell sheep. She raises them in a corral located in the rear section of their property. Once they have grown she sells them in the local market. She has had this business for more than 3 years and in that time she has been able to obtain a fixed clientele and experience in the business.

Victoria wishes to purchase balanced feed so that her sheep will reach an ideal weight and also to make improvements to the corral. This way she will be able to expand her business by increasing the number of livestock from what she actually has and consequently increasing her sales. She requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to reach her goals which are overdue.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to improve the corral where she keeps her sheep.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a 56-year-old housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and taking care of her family. Her husband is an electrician by profession and provides electrical repair services to his clients. He is very good at his work. Two of Khalida’s sons also work to contribute to the family financially. Her eldest son is an electrician, the second one is a motor mechanic and the other two are studying. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because he wants to buy electrical repair tools to improve his business. Khalida hopes that after the investment, her husband will be able to provide better service to his clients and increase his profits. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools

loans.name: Cindy Elena

texts.es: Cindy es una joven de 22 años que vivie con su conyuge en el barrio El Prado del municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; ella es la propietaria de un negocio llamado “Drogueria Emmanuel Hoyos”, que inició   desde que su conyuge dejò de trabajar en una empresa y con su liquidaciòn invirtieron en una vitrina, la que surtieron de medicinas alopaticas y a la que agregaron diferentes productos requerídos por las ama de casa. Muy pronto los clientes fueron acercandose poco a poco incrementano su demanda y en casa de un familiar adecuaron su pequeña farmacia y adicionaron nuevas vitrinas y estanterìa. Hoy venden de contado y tambien otorgan creditos especialmente en las variedades y ya tienen un local independiente en otra comunidad. Sus esfuerzos han surtido efectos en sus ingresos, pero necesitan crecer mas,  porque tienen el sueño de manejar un amplio inventario, para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes. aunque su mayor desafio es su capital de trabajo, que no es suficiente para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hacen a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprarán medicamentos sin restricción médica, pañales desechables y productos de higiene personal. Su sueño es tener su propia casa con local. Mientras esto ocurre Cindy y su cónyuge se esmeran en construìr su futuro familiar, sosteniendo su negocio con una rentabilidad no menor del 35%  que planean aumentra para aumentar la reinversiòn de su dinero al negocio.
texts.en:
Cindy, 22, is a young woman living with her spouse in Soledad’s El Prado neighborhood, 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She owns a business called “Droguería Emmanuel Hoyos” that she started when her husband stopped working for a firm.  They used his severance pay to buy a display case that they stocked with allopathic medicine and added products required by housewives.  Very soon customers started coming by and gradually demand increased.  They set up a small pharmacy in their house and added new display cases and shelving.  Now, they sell for cash and also grant some credit especially on novelties.  They now have an independent branch in another community.

Her efforts have had effects on her income but they need to grow more because their dream is to handle an ample inventory to meet customer demand although her greatest challenge is working capital, which is insufficient to accomplish this.

This is the reason behind their call for a Kiva loan, their first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that they will use to buy over-the-counter medicine, disposable diapers and personal hygiene items.

Her dream is to have a house of her own with a locale attached.  While this happens, Cindy and her spouse strive to build their family future maintaining their business with a profit margin of no less than 35% which they plan to increase in order to increase the reinvestment of their money into the business.

loans.use: to buy over-the-counter medicines, disposable diapers and personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 35 years old. She has nine children from 6 to 23 years old. They are all in school. She is a widow. 

Chantal owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items such as sugar, matches, flour, rice, etc. She has done this business for five years and it’s going well. It has enabled her to meet the need of her family and pay her children’s school fees. 

She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business by buying more items to put in her store and make more profits. With the profits, she plans to save until she can afford to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more items for sale.

loans.name: Clencia

texts.en:
Clencia is 45 years old and has a partner that she lives with. She has two children who are 17 and 7 years old. Clencia has a business selling various crafts in Ollantaytambo, a small town that receives many tourists. 

She is asking for a 100 PEN loan to buy crafts and other souvenirs to sell such as colorful blankets, briefcases, and paintings. She is very happy to receive the loan and is committed to making all payments on time.

loans.use: to buy crafts to sell to tourists

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a single man who owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Tsuma has operated a business buying and selling maize and charcoal. He sells from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of scarcity of maize products for sale. Tsuma dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

Tsuma plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize to resell

loans.name: Ledy Yuli

texts.es:
Ledy tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, el cual no tiene los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura, ganadería y artesana.

Ledy desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos y gallinas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales; para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y poder ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona, para obtener muy buenas ganancias que le ayudarán a solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectiva comida, con la finalidad de obtener un mejor precio con sus clientes, lo que permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Ledy es una madre trabajadora, empeñosa y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio prospere para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ledy is thirty-one and lives with her husband and children in their own house, which does not have basic utilities.  They live in the rural area of the Mochumí district in the department of Lambayeque.  The primary activities in this region are agriculture, cattle, and handicrafts.  

For a number of years Ledy has earned her living raising and selling poultry (turkeys and chickens).  The pen is behind the house.  She feeds the birds a balanced diet with natural grains for optimal growth.  That way she can sell them at local markets for really good profits that will help pay household expenses.

Ledy has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 soles to buy more poultry and feed so she can get better prices and improve her family's standard of living.  She is a hard-working mother and very responsible; all she wants if for her business to prosper so her family can succeed.

loans.use: to buy more poulty and feed.

loans.name: Makauzviitire Group

texts.en:
This is 27 year old Patience (raisng her hand) from Masvingo, a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. She is married with two children, one attending school.  Patience runs a flea market business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of working capital. 

Patience has requested a loan of $300 to buy blouses, tracksuits and sandals. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Patience plans to operate a retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals for resale

loans.name: Hellen Tatiana

texts.es: Hellen Tatiana, tiene la edad 30 de años, está casada y vive con sus 2 hijos y esposo actualmente. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal. Ella comprara todo lo necesario para surtir su cafetal y tenerlo en condiciones favorables. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación y sembrado ya desde varios años atrás. Ella quiere darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y así poder ayudarle a su esposo a tener mayor facilidad con las responsabilidades de su hogar. Trabajando juntos, Hellen y su esposo Edgardo quieren generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar y seguir adelante con su proyecto. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Helen y Edgardo no habían tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo a Helen con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Hellen Tatiana is 30 years old, married, and lives with her 2 children and present husband. With this loan she intends to buy the inputs needed to supply her grove of coffee trees. She plans to buy everything she needs for her trees and to maintain them in favorable condition. 

Hellen has had appropriate terrain for cultivating and planting coffee trees for many years now. She wants to offer her children a better quality of life and, also, to make it easier for her husband to provide  for the responsibilities of the home. Working together, Hellen and her husband Edgardo want to generate the largest possible earnings for their well-being and to continue ahead with her project.

This is Hellen's first loan through FUDECOSUR. Hellen and Edgardo have not had previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with all facilities and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy inputs for the maintenance and improvement of her coffee trees.

loans.name: Amanjol

texts.en: Amanjol is 29 years old and lives with his sisters, mother, wife and daughter in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His sisters are college students. His wife works at the local photo studio. He started a business in 2004 selling meat with his sister. In 2007 he started to work at the car body shop that belongs to his brother. His monthly salary was 150,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). In April 2011 he opened a tire repair center and his business is doing well. In the future he plans to expand his business and open a car repair center. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I want to build a big house for my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase additional equipment for his business and increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his business and increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products (rice, fish, eggs, peanuts, etc.).

loans.name: Kyakijara Tukwatanize Group

texts.en: Janet is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been selling cereals for 15 years. She started with 50,000 shillings and now her working capital is 500,000 shillings. Her desire is to own a food store in the next five years. Janet needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 55 years old. He sells food and groceries with his wife at home and earns $11 per day. They have three children, two are helping Sopheap to sell food and one more is working in a factory, earning $3.50 per day. 

Every month, he has to spend $100 on food, $40 on electricity, and $25 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy more grocery goods to sell in his store. He plans to extend the grocery store to sell more goods so that he can make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Diego David

texts.es:
Diego David tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Diego  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos  para los cultivos.
Con la ayuda del préstamo aumentará y mejorara la producción, le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas a los cultivos.
El sueño es llegar a tener una finca y una casa para poder vivir tranquilos sin preocuparse de los arriendos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo, es solidaria, tranquila, trabajadora y le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Diego David, 21, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

Diego is a farmer; he grows corn, soya and cocoa beans.  His purchases and his sales take place in San José del Tambo every weekend.

He asks for the loan to be able to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and supplies for the crops.  With help from the loan he will increase and improve production which will help him meet his economic needs.  He faces frequent challenges like competition and crop pests.

His dream is to have a farm and a house of his own one day to live in peace and not have to worry about paying rent.

In his free time he likes to go out on excursions.  He’s supportive, calm and hardworking and enjoys celebrating the carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Fanya Kazi Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Fanya Kazi group. Her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Alice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to eradicate poverty and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 22 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Alice was only able to harvest 12 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and ensure food security
In 2012, the members of Fanya Kazi group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Alice is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is a responsible and hard working parent. He is married and has one child. He didn't finish his degree course due to financial difficulties. Despite his experiences, he bears in mind that he needs to continue aiming for his dreams. Johnny is aiming to increase his rice production in order to have a plentiful harvest this crop season. Aiming for bigger dreams is not an easy thing said Johnny, because you will be enduring hardships and difficulties. 

Johnny is asking for a loan amount of P35,000 which will be used to pay for the labor cost of tilling the farm land and to buy farm materials in order to improve the growth of rice crops. This would really help him in sustaining family needs.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of tilling farm land and to buy farm materials to improve the growth of rice crops.

loans.name: Jonie Chris

texts.en:
Jonie Chris is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Jonie Chris is runs a habal-habal service (motorbike transporting several people). He has had this business for two years. He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Jonie Chris joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jonie Chris hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorbike transport service.

loans.name: Thumu

texts.en: Thumu is taking another Kiva loan of Kes 40,000 to boost her beauty salon business, where she serves her neighbours and passersby. With the loan she wants to purchase beauty products and a blow dryer. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and a blow dryer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, aged 27 years-old, is married to Beatrice and they are blessed with one child. He has been selling trousers for six years which gives him a monthly income of Kes. 20,000.

This is his first loan with Kiva partner KADET.  He will use the funds to buy more trousers for sale. John will use the expected profits to open a boutique and hopes to educate his child.

loans.use: to buy clothing stock.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single mother of two. Rachel owns a cosmetics shop which has been running for the last two years. She obtained the startup capital from her mother. She was introduced to Milango by her friends.

Rachel is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new stocks of cosmetics. She looks forward to owning a cosmetics supermarket in the future. Rachel will use the extra income to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of cosmetics.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai is 47-years-old with 3 children. Two of them are in high school and elementary school. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing vegetables and cherry blossoms for the Tet holiday. Participating in our credit program in 2004, she used a loan effectively for expanding her business. For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam dong to buy vegetables for growing and fertilizer.

Huyen is 28-years-old with 2 children. She is managing a small hair  salon. She wants to have a  loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy hair care products

Tho is 33-years-old with 2 children. She is  growing cheery blossoms, and rasing  pigs. She needs to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy food and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for growing and fertilizer.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos que requiere en su familia tiene un cultivo de frutas y verduras el cual vende en la plaza de mercado de su municipio. La actividad la aprendió desde muy temprana edad, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y se la enseñó desde muy joven, lo que le ha permitido tener una gran experiencia y así poder diferenciarse ante sus clientes. Para sacar su cultivo adelante, Milton busca un préstamo para comprar abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas y hacer el cuidado necesario que requieren sus cultivos para sacar productos de buena calidad.

De esta manera podrá vender los productos de su cosecha a un buen precio permitiendo tener unos buenos ingresos en su hogar, de modo que su esposa y su hijo puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es tener un cultivo muy grande con muchas siembras más y así poder algún día generar empleo y brindarle a su hijo buenas condiciones económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas y hacer el cuidado necesario que requieren sus cultivos para sacar productos de buena calidad.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en: Mrs. Batchuluun lives with 3 children in the eastern province of Mongolia. 3 years ago her husband passed away from factory accident. So she needs to maintain one's family and pay 3 children`s school fee. Currently she worked in little factory of ice cream. But this work was seasonal and the salary was small in wintertime.  Therefore she has started a ready made clothes trading business in 2010. She rents a place in the market and her working capital is about 3,000,000 MNT. Now she requests a 2.500.000 MNT for import the goods from China, because school season will start in September. Mrs.Batchuluun is a healthful, willpower woman. She wishes to have her children go to school and to become an education citizens.

loans.use: To import the goods from China

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 24 years old and has two children. Analyn is a woman and has one child in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn  requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Analyn has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family on hotel of railway station In the city of Sumgayit. 46-year-old Mehdi has 3 children. Before he wanted to open his own market, he could not do it. Is the only breadwinner in family. 4 years ago he has rented a minishop of railway station. He borrowed the loan amount of $200 to buy the foodstuffs. The borrowed his second loan $500 he spent to increase the foodstuffs. 
Now he applies for the loan of $1000 to increase the foodstuffs.

loans.use: to increase the foodstuffs

loans.name: Yadiyar

texts.en:
24-year-old Yadiyar is a mother of 2 children. She  lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. She has 3 years experience in this business. She works very hard for the success of her children. With this business she meets the demands of her family.
Now Yadiyar needs a loan of $500 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Adurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is married and has 2 children and has been running his business for 6 years. He began his activity in 1990 by baking bread in his own bakery. His wife and children help him in his business. Abdurahmon became a client of MicroInvest  in 2006. He has gradually grown his business and runs a canteen.  

He owns canteen Karim bobo, one of the liveliest places in the Nay.  He has many loyal clients and they come their to have their dinner, get a rest and listening music. He offers a menu of tasty dishes, soft and alcoholic beverages, warm round cakes and so on.

In the future he plans to grow his canteen and therefore he is going to use the loan for building a second floor. He also plans on hiring three more employees.

loans.use: Building a second floor for a canteen which sells food and beverages

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto has a small dairy and grows vegetables and fowers, which his wife sells in the city of La Paz. They derive their income from these efforts, which is just enough to make ends meet. They have two children who help out on the farm and no longer go to school.

They live in the region of Palomar--Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

He would use the loan to buy a milk cow to increase his production and raise his income. This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan, with which he hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from the Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Fausto, es productor de leche de vaca y es agricultor de hortalizas y flores que su esposa comercializa en la Ciudad de La Paz; sus ingresos provienen de estas actividades y alcanzan exactamente para mantener a su familia; tiene dos hijos que le ayudan con el trabajo del campo y ya no están estudiando. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar – Rió Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crédito será utilizado en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite acceder al préstamo y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida su familia.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 48 years old and the mother of 3 children. She owns a small fruit and vegetable shop in the area of Nabaa in Beirut. Before opening her own shop, Mariam rented a stand at the vegetable market. With 3 consecutive loans from Al Majmoua, she was able to open her own shop and ensure a stable daily income for her family.

Mariam needs a loan of US$350 to buy a larger stock of fruits and vegetables than usual. She expects a higher volume of sales in the coming weeks due to the approaching holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for her small fresh food shop

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa S. is 48 years old. He is married to Aminata, who is a housewife, and has 8 children. He lives with his family in Adjamé, a populated suburb in the north of the Abidjan district. Moussa sells various women's fashion articles in the Adjamé market. Moussa has been in this business for many years, and has been able to earn enough to support his family. Moussa is a dynamic tradesman. His shop is well-replenished with ladies' fashion articles, and he manages to make a good profit margin from selling these goods. In expectation of the coming celebrations of Aid El Kebir, Christmas and the New Year, Moussa would like to purchase more goods for sale, in order to meet his customers' needs. He is asking for a loan of US$1025 for this purpose. Moussa has been enrolled in the AE&I microcredit program since 2005 and has had a good credit performance since then.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Taufua

texts.en: Taufua is a twenty-six year old mother of three children who runs both a small farm and a fishing business. Her husband works for Yazaki EDS Company and is not earning enough to support his family. Taufua is very happy to be in our program to have financial assistance to keep her business growing, so she can help out her husband with taking care of their family financially. She aims to keep both businesses growing to earn good income to provide her children with a better education than she and her husband got.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her little farm and new fishing nets

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en: Erkin K. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 4 children. He is a client of MicroInvest since 2003;  an active client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and applies permanently for business support loans. He started his business with selling small housewares and now has his own outlet selling haunches, brooms, clothespins and bath sponges that he purchases from suppliers. The prices for his goods are lower than the bazaar's prices and therefore he has repeat customers. He is requesting a loan to purchase new goods.

loans.use: for purchase of new inventory

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu O.  is a 43 year old mother of 3. She hails from Mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and provisions and has been in business since 1999. She requests a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Adigozal

texts.en: Adigozal was born in 1976. He is single, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and settled in the Absheron region. Two years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes to improve his business and grow profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his business

loans.name: Rayo De Luz Group

texts.en:
Minerva lives in San Pedro de Macoris with her three children (ages: 10, 9, and 4). She runs a small grocery store, which supplies basic foods and drinks for her community. With this loan she wants to buy more merchandise in order to increase her clientele. She thinks that if she has a larger stock with more variety she will attract new customers. Rice, beans, milk, and sugar are her most popular items. In the future she hopes to have a large business and a proper home for herself and her family.

We are excited to see what Minerva and the rest of her group will do with their loans. On behalf of everyone, Esperanza would like to thank you for your support! God Bless.

loans.use: For rice, beans, candy, sugar, and bread

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel, a young 24-year-old, makes his living as an auto mechanic. He works at a shop called El Moreno in the city of Juigalpa. With his salary he supports his mother and takes care of his life partner and their three-year-old son.

He is interested in this loan because he wishes to buy mechanic’s wrenches to be able to do work in the shop after his shift and to make house calls to do personal repairs for vehicle owners that request his services outside the shop because he can’t use the shop’s equipment and tools when he’s off duty.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El Joven Jose Manuel de 24 años de edad, se gana la vida como mecanico automotriz, labora en el taller El Moreno de la ciudad de Juigalpa, con su salario apoya a su mamá y mantiene a su compañera de vida y a su hijo de 3 años.

Está interesado en este credito porque desea comprar llaves de mecánica y poder hacer trabajos en su taller despues de su turno, reparaciones personalizadas a domicilios a dueños de vehiculos que le soliciten el servicio fuera de su taller, porque no puede utilizar los equipos y herramientas fuera de su turno de labores en el taller.

loans.use: Purchase wrenches and shop equipment

loans.name: Wahid Allah

texts.en: Wahid Allah lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and married with one son. He was out of Afghanistan for about 5 years and when he returned one year ago he opened a mobile phones sells shop. His business is going very well and he needs money to enlarge his shop and complete his stock to make a better income for his family.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and complete his stock

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng S., 57, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her five children. She sells food from her bicycle stand. She typically makes $5 USD each day as she travels around and selling vegetables, pork, and beef from her bicycle. She has had this business for the last eight years. Her family is also aided by the support of two of the children who work in construction and use their income to help the rest of the family.

Cheng S. believes that she has a very good business, but that she could increase her income if she was able to access more customers. The best way for her to access more customers is for her to upgrade her bicycle to a motorbike. She has asked for a loan of $900 USD to make this investment. She anticipates a great improvement in her business and looks forward to seeing the return on her investment.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to use as a portable food stand

loans.name: Victoria Pascuala

texts.es:
Seven years ago, Victoria needed to look for work because her husband´s salary was not enough to cover the family´s expenses. After looking for a long time, she decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Little by little her sales increased and now she would also like to sell new clothing so that she can offer more choice to her customers and earn more income.

She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 4 months, to buy goods and increase her inventory, and to be able to offer more options to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria desde hace 7 años se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, después de mucho buscar decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, y fue así como poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas y es ahora que quiere surtir con ropa nueva para así tener mas opciones para sus clientes, y tener un mayor ingreso

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y así aumentar su inventario, para poder ofrecerles más opciones a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Q. vive en casa de sus padres (calle 23 de marzo, zona de Obispo Bosque, ciudad de La Paz), junto a su hija y el abuelo (el esposo que es policía esta trabajando en el Chapare, una zona tropical del departamento de Cochabamba, pero su salario es mínimo). Martha solicita crédito para cubrir los gastos médicos de su padre quien no puede caminar debido a un doloroso accidente. 

Es cliente antigua de Impro, tiene un buen historial y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Martha Q. lives in her parents’ house (23 de marzo Street, Obispo Bosque zone, La Paz) with her daughter and grandfather. Her husband, who is a police officer, is working in the Chapare, a tropical zone in Cochabamba, but his salary is minimal. Martha is requesting this loan to cover her father’s medical costs. Martha’s father cannot walk because of a painful accident. Martha is an old client of Impro. She has a good record and can manage a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover medical expenses

loans.name: Tetteh

texts.en:
Tetteh K. is a 30 year old trader who is married and has two kids.  His children are currently in school.  His major challenge is paying school fees.  He hopes to increase his savings to support his childrens' education to give them better future career opportunities. He belongs to the community group called "Adjinyemise" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other as social collateral and assist one another in repaying their loans.

He has been selling cereal and charcoal in the local market for three years now. He requests a loan to enable him to trek to surrounding villages to buy more stock of maize and charcoal in order to avoid middlemen.  This will allow him to grow his business and increase profit.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and charcoal.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es:
La señora Narda Córdova  Murrugarrra tiene 29 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Elena II y vive en MZ A 39 lote 15 Manuel Arévalo II etapa del distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Narda estudió Enfermería Técnica, pero no ejerce su profesión debido a que se casó a los 23 años y se dedicó a cuidar a sus 2 hijos una niña y un niño, este último con rasgos de semi autismo al cual tiene que dedicar mucho tiempo.
Actualmente vende productos de belleza y joyas por catálogo. A partir del siguiente mes tendrá una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde venderá productos de primera necesidad.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas, compró y vendió productos naturales de salud.
Con este crédito de 1300 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas surtirá su bodega, comprando artículos básicos como; arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.
Narda sueña con el día en que pueda ver a su hijo completamente sano.
texts.en:
Señora Narda Córdova Murrugarrra is 29 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Santa Elena II, and she lives at MZ A 39 lote 15 Manuel Arévalo Il Etapa in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad Perú. Narda studied technical nursing, but she didn’t go into her professional because she was married at 23 years old and she dedicated herself ot caring for her two children, one daughter and one son. The son has the challenges of being semi-autistic and so he requires a lot of time to care for. At the moment she sells beauty products and jewelry by catalouge. At the end of the next month she will have a small store in her home, where she will sell products of basic necessity. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in 4 installments she created her store, buying basics like rice, sugar, oil, etc. Narda dreams of the day that she might see her son completely healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for Narda's shop

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy A. is 38 years old and married with a child. She sells yams. The demands for her yam are high. She hopes to expand her business so that she can have more customers. She requests a $350 loan to purchase more yams to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana M.shahzad Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a 28 year old married lady who resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 17 years. She completed her education until 10th standard and then she got married. Her husband's name is M. and he works in a cotton factory. She has three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education in a local school located near the house. Rukhsana baji has a cloth sewing business. She does this work to make herself busy. This activity gives her a return in the shape of money. She saves her income for her children’s good future. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her sewing machine.

She is the leader of a group with a few more women. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Maqboolan baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Ghulam Qubra baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a sewing machine used for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni cuenta con 28 años de edad, viene conviviendo con su pareja más de 9 años, fruto de ello tienen un hijo, esta familia vive en su casa propia. A los 19 años tuvo su hijo, desde entonces empezó a trabajar en la chacra con su esposo como lo hacía su madre y su padre, tenía que hacer todas sus labores cargando a su bebe, ahora que ha crecido su hijo ya no lo considera su trabajo pesado ni dificultoso. Esta temporada va a sembrar 30 sacos de semilla de papa, y dos bolsas de alverja, ya tiene preparada su tierra y solo falta abrir los surcos. Marleni al igual que sus demás paisanos quiso comprar la semilla llamada súper mejorada que es muy resistente y da una mejor producción; pero esta semilla está muy escasa y de un costo elevado. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha pagado sin dificultades sus cuotas fijadas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semilla de arvejas en un importe 800 soles, el resto del dinero lo utilizara en la compra de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Marleni is 28 years old and has lived with her partner for more than nine years. They have a son together and live in a house they own. She had her son at 19 years old, and since then has been working on the farm with her husband just as her mother and father did. She had to do all her work carrying her baby. Now that he is older, she does not consider her work to be strenuous or difficult. This season, she will sow 30 bags of seed potato and two bags of peas. She has already prepared her land; only the furrows need to be plowed. Marleni, like her fellow farmers, wants to buy the "súper mejorada" brand of seed as it is highly resistant and produces a more abundant crop, but this seed is very small and very expensive. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she has always repaid her loans on time. She will use the loan to buy 800 soles' worth of pea seeds and the rest of the money to buy insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and insecticide.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida T. is engaged in rice farming. She grows and sells rice to help her 8 married children. She is 50 years old  and the only thing that she worries about is the future of her children because they all married so early. She still helps her children sustain their new families. Her harvest is used for the family's consumption and the remainder is  sold in the market for additional income. She started her farm business in 1980 on 1 ½ hectares of  land. Now her farm is growing and established.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 to increase her harvest. In this way, she believes, she will have more profit to share with her married children. Her loan will be used to buy herbicides and fertilizers needed for her farm.

CEVI provides their clients not just with a loan but also with training, savings services and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy herbicides and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Loeurm's Group

texts.en:
A small group loan is being requested by five members, all of whom live in Siem Reap Province.

V., 40, is a widowed mother of two children who are still young. She earns a living by raising pigs in her pigpen behind her house. She always sells her mature pigs for a good price to the slaughter after raising them for four months. She plans to have a shop selling cooked ingredients and other domestic materials in order to meet the family's expenses. So V. is looking for a loan to build a small grocery store.

And the other members are: C., 30, who sells soft drinks in front of the market and is taking out a loan to build a shop for her business; S., 24, who sells porridge and Khmer noodle and is looking for a loan to buy more chairs and tables for her business; K., 27, who is a souvenir seller and is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her business' transportation; and G., 31, who sells sweets in the market and is taking out a loan to buy a motorbike for her business' transportation. The loan will help them attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a small shop for a grocery store

loans.name: Rashida M. Nazir Group

texts.en:
Rashida is a 58 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, for the past 25 years.  

Her husband's name is M. N. who is a vegetable seller by profession.  He has been in this profession for the past 10 years.  Rashida is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter.  Both of her kids are getting an education.  Rashida prepares embroidered dresses to pay off the school fees of her kids.  

She successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying again for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband’s vegetable selling business.

She is the group leader of three another women from her locality.  Shahida wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store.  Sharifan wants a loan to buy wood to sell.  Rasoolan wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan.  Loan funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy vegetables and other items to sell.

loans.name: Motunrayo

texts.en: Motunrayo A. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She sells yams to retail customers, and has been doing so for a long time. Motunrayo is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more yam tubers to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase yam tubers to resell

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Mrs. Bienvinida G. is a resident of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, 40 years old, married with 7 children. Her husband is a farmer and carpenter. She joined PMPC 4 years ago and the Co-op became her help in accomplishing her plans and project. She is one of the active members of Kaymito Center. Right now she is applying for a loan of Php 14,900 for the purpose of purchasing housing materials to renovate her house.

Her future plan is to be able to send her children to college and to be able to renovate her house. Above all, she hopes that her husband will have good produce in the farm so that they can pay their loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for her house

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
En 2007, cette jeune femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de mèche et de tissages qu’elle vend en détail. Sa clientèle est constituée en majorité de coiffeuse. Elle est seule à faire ce commerce dans son quartier ce qui est un avantage pour elle. Elle veut agrandir son activité et  sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de nouveaux modèles de mèches et de tissages.
Elle est célibataire, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
In 2007, this young woman got started in the commerce of hair extensions and weaves that she sells retail. Her customers are composed of mostly hairdressers. She is the only one having this business in her district, and it's an advantage for her. She wants to expand her business and is therefore requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy new models of hair extensions and weaves. She is unmarried, and this work enables her to support herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
A. Shoira is 29 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now Shoira dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle and with the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Shoira asks for a 750 USD loan in order to buy more calves to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her family's quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose sells foodstuff. Bose is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Bose is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Alma Yanira

texts.es: Alma Yanira M. M. reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Alma tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos Jonathan de 10 años, Daniel de 8 años, Emanuel de 6 años y Miguelito de 4 años de edad todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Alma posee un negocio donde vende variedad de almuerzos, ella vende su comida en el centro comercial donde se encuentran muchas oficinas y maquilas a los alrededores, es así como ha logrado hacer una clientela muy estable. Alma solicita un crédito para insumos utilizados en la elaboración de sus platillos de esa manera lograría aumentar su margen de ventas.
texts.en:
Alma Yanira M. Martinez lives in Ciudad Arce in the La Libertad department. Alma is 32 years old, and is a single mother of four. Jonathan is 10, Daniel is 8, Emanuel is 6 and Miguelito is 4 years old. All her children are currently in school. Alma has a business where she sells a variety of lunches. She sells her food in a shopping center located between offices and factories, and this is how she has acquired a stable clientele. Alma is requesting a loan for the ingredients required to make her dishes, and this way she can increase her sales margin.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Tzanjuyup Group

texts.es: Son un grupo de personas de 9 integrantes entre ellas hay hombres, se encuentran ubicadas a 21 kilometro de la ciudad, Las personas solicitantes del credito actualmente se dedican a difierentes actividades economicas tales como; comercio (compra y venta de delantales), así también a la crianza de animales (gallinas, cerdos, vacas ovejas etc.), y servicio (trabajos domesticos en hogares de forma mensual y trabajos agricolas en el campo entre otros), todos los miembros han demostrado de manera clara que cuentan con una actividad economica que garantiza el retorno del capital que se les esta otorgando, y dicho prestamo permitira ampliar su generación de ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
This is a group of nine people, including men. They are located 21 kilometers from the city. They are requesting a loan for their different economic activities such as buying and selling aprons, raising animals (hens, pigs, cows, sheep, etc.) and services (domestic jobs, agricultural work, etc.). All of the members have demonstrated in a clear manner that they have an economic activity that guarantees the return of the capital that is being offered to them. This loan will let them increase their generation of income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juanita P. C. es una señora grande de edad y no por ello le impide ser una mujer  emprendedora y llena de ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. Desde hace tres años coloco un negocio en un cuarto de su casa con el deseo de hacerlo mas grande, la señora comenta que empezó con poco capital y con el tiempo las ganancias le permitirán surtir mas su tienda de abarrotes. Ahora ella muy preocupada por que su negocio prospere al igual que ella y su familia quiere invertirle para que así puedan ver más ganancias y seguir con su proyecto.
Su esposo es un agricultor de alfalfa  que la vende a otras partes de la ciudad y rancherías de por aquí cerca, su hija siempre esta al pendiente de ellos y con sus ingresos ayuda a los gastos que se tienen en la vivienda.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio de Abarrotes

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is already 30 years of age. She is currently residing at Barangay Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela with her twin children and her sister- in- law. Her husband’s name is Albert Allan M. who is a Civil Engineer and is currently working abroad. Their twin are Amira Jane and Amira Claire, they are presently studying in a nursery school in their town at Angadanan, Isabela. 


She manages a mini grocery store in their place for almost 2 years. She also tried selling business for 10 months in their public market. Her weekly average net income from the business is around PHP2, 000 and which is being utilized to roll in her general store and also for the needs of her children. She wanted to avail a loan of PHP25, 000 from KIVA lenders in order to improve her store into a grocery. According to her, because of her children she is patiently managing her business for it to become more progressive.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Taborsu Group

texts.en:
Here are Alex S., Abdul K., Fatmata S. and Fatmata F.. They named their group Taborsu, a Temne phrase meaning “Let them borrow us”. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them increase the size and quality of their businesses.

The leader of this group is Alex S. on the left. Alex is now age forty, married to a businesswoman, and the two of them have two children: one in Junior Secondary School I, and the other in class III. Alex sells secondhand clothes (used clothing) and has been in this business for fifteen years now. He will use this loan to buy more bales of used clothing. In Freetown, where he buys the clothes, a bale usually costs him something between Le 450,000 – Le 600,000.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Nelly De

texts.es: Nelly tiene a todos sus hijos que son mayores de edad y también son independientes. Nelly actualmente vive en la casa de sus hijas, Nelly trabaja como operaria de costura en una sastrería conocida de la zona cerca de donde vive. Por otra parte también desarrolla en su domicilio todo tipo de confecciones y arreglos de vestimenta, claro esto ya de manera particular e independiente. La competnecia en este rubro es mediana, lo que le favorece es el hecho de trabajar en una sastrería que tiene ya una experiencia y reputación ganada. El crédito está destinado a la reparación de su máquina de costurar y a la cancelación de un saldo anterior que adeuda. Esta será la cuarta operación de crédito con la institución y durante el tiempo de la relación comercial ella demostró responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
All of Nelly’s children are older and on their own. Nelly currently lives in her daughters’ home. She works as a seamstress in a tailors that is well known in her area. She also takes in sewing at home as an independent contractor and makes all sorts of different clothes and repairs. There is some competition in this field, but not much. What helps her is that she also works at a well regarded and established tailor. The loan is to fix her sewing machine and to pay off the balance on an earlier debt. This will be her fourth loan with this institution; she has proved herself responsible in paying her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix a sewing machine and pay off balance on earlier debt

loans.name: Barracks 2 Nakalebe Florence Group

texts.en: N. Florence is a hardworking businesswoman of forty-six years old. She is widowed with two children, and she has five school-age dependents. She deals in the charcoal business, and she has been in her business for four years. She is requesting this loan to purchase bags of charcoal, at least over fifty, to add stock in her business, which will also add capital to her business. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to complete her rental houses to enable her to manage her family well and educate the children (dependents).

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal, at least over fifty, to add stock in her business

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun K., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Sopha Chan, 32, have been growing vegetables for three years. In addition, they have been renting musical instruments for one year. They were married in 2004 and have two sons: one attends school and the other one is still too young. They live along National Road No. 1 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Saroeun Saroeun is now requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase a generator for his business.
Saroeun is in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Pauline Awino

texts.en: Pauline Awino O. owns Kiowang Investment where she sells cosmetics, detergents, cooking oil, flour, salt and sugar to walk-ins and local customers. She has run this business for the last six years.  Her business is located at Manyatta market (local market) and challenges are strong competition and fluctuating demand.  She is using the proceeds of the KES40,000 loan to buy cosmetics and beauty products.  In the future, she wants to be a wholesaler and educate her children.  Pauline is married with three children and describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la haute couture, après son apprentissage, elle s’est lancée dans son propre commerce en ouvrant son atelier qu’elle a nommé « GAELLE PRET A PORTER » dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé. Elle s’est spécialisée plus tard dans la vente de bazins. En cette période de fêtes la demande de ses clients est élevée, elle veut les satisfaire raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  25 bazins de différents modèles.
texts.en:
This woman studied fine dressmaking. After her apprenticeship she started her own business, opening a studio she called “Gaelle Pret A Porter” in Lomé’s Kégué neighborhood. She went on to specialize in the sale of “bazin” (a popular, woven cotton damask). During the festive season, customer demand is high. To satisfy her customers, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 lengths of "bazin" in different styles.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bazin cloth

loans.name: Las Provincianas Group

texts.es:
“LAS PROVINCIANAS ” es un grupo de 9 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”, ellas concientes de mejorar y fortalecer sus negocios, necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo y seguir operando en sus negocios,  sobre todo en esta época de fin de año donde la demanda de productos se incrementa.
Ellas  tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de chamarras, chompas, verduras, mantas, calculadoras y otros, esta es la segunda oportunidad que solicitan el préstamo a través del financiamiento de kiva.
texts.en:
“LAS PROVINCIANAS” is a group of 9 women and 1 man. They attend their meetings in the Main Center “Alto Lima”. They are conscious of improving and strengthening their businesses. They need the loan to increase their working capital and to continue running their businesses, above all at this time of year when the demand for their products increases. They have their own sales businesses such as jackets, sweaters, vegetables, blankets, calculators and others. This is the second time they are applying for a loan through kiva financing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
