Joseph is 50 years old and married with four children. His wife is a petty trader and she also supports the home. His children are excelling well in school and Joseph hopes to give them a good quality education.
Joseph is a farmer who grows cassava and yams on his farm. He has been in the farming business for five years. He loves farming because he is happy whenever he harvests his crops. Joseph is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization, and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to clear his farmland and purchase more cassava seedlings to plant during the next planting season. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

About Lift Above Poverty Organization
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To clear his farmland and purchase cassava seedlings

loans.name: Aura Marcia

texts.es:
La señora Aura Marcia A., vive en una comunidad de san Rafael del sur, ella es casada con 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son de edad escolar, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de guineos y plátanos estos los compra en el mercado Municipal de san Rafael del sur y luego los comercializa en su comunidad, ella está solicitando su préstamo para poder incrementar su negocio ya que si compra por 2 o 3 cabezas de guineos le dan un precio más bajo y así ella también dará un precio menor y sus ventas se incrementaran obteniendo ella más ganancias.

Tiene 4 años de estar trabajando con Ceprodel de los cuales ha sido beneficiada con 8 prestamos estos los había utilizado para mejorar su casa de habitación, pero ahora lo necesita para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Marcia A. lives in the community of San Rafael del Sur. She is married with 4 children, 2 of whom are school-age. She deals in guinea-hens and plantains, which she buys in the Municipal Market of San Rafael del Sur, then sells in her community. Aura is soliciting a loan to be able to increase her business. If she buys 2 or 3 head of guinea-hens at once, she gets a lower price and, then, she can offer them at a better price, and her sales will increase, producing more earnings. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and has benefited with 8 loans. Past loans have been used to improve the house she lives in, but now she needs a loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING GUINEA-HENS BY THE HEAD AND PLANTAINS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Angélica Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora está solicitando un crédito con CEPRODEL para la compra de artículos escolares y uniformes, ella es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar a los que ella les quiere brindar todo su apoyo para que tengan un futuro mejor. Ella trabaja de secretaria en la Alcaldía de Nindirí con este salario  ella provee el sustento  y una vida digna a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
She is requesting a credit with Ceprodel for the purchase of school supplies and uniformes. She is a single mother, and has two school-aged children to whom she wants to give all her support so that they can have a better life. She works as a secretary in the Nindirí town hall, and with this salary she gives sustenance and a life of dignity to her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. and her husband, Mr. Sarum Seng, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1987 and have five sons. The couple are farmers: they grow vegetables and flowers. They depend on farming so they want to continue the business and hope their business will continue to do well. Mom has obtained one previous Kiva loan. Now, she is asking for her second loan of US$150 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her vegetable and flower farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en: Ma. Victoria I. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Ma. Victoria is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ma. Victoria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ma. Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda H. possesses several sources of income. She is engaged in farming, hog raising, goat raising and poultry. She is 55 years old, married to Marlon, and they have five children. Her eldest child is 22 years old.  She wanted to join CEVI to finance her business. She would like to borrow 15,000 PHP. The loan will be used to buy feed, vaccines, and farm supplies.

loans.use: Feed, vaccines, farm supplies

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa A. is a 27 year old, married man, from Gaza. He lives with his wife and two children. Alaa opened his own clothes store back in 2008, when he realized that there were no stores of this kind in their local area. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to buy new types of clothes, which will bring in more customers, and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new types of fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is 26 years old and single. He lives in Baku city with his parents. He works as an independent contractor and takes great pride in his work. Rustam M. learned how to build from his grandfather, who also build houses. He enjoys working and has many happy customers.
Rustam is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more tools for his construction business so that he can take on more work and expand to work with other men.

loans.use: To buy more tools for his construction business

loans.name: Zulaikhan's Group

texts.en:
Zulaikhan lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari with her family. Her husband works in a factory while Zulaikhan runs a grocery shop out of her home. Presently, she is not running it because she has almost finished off her stock by selling it. She has changed her business to sewing. Now she runs a domestic sewing business. This business doesn’t give her the expected amount. That’s why she has decided to start the grocery business again. She mentioned that there is potential in the grocery business because her shop was the only one in her area. Zulaikhan has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest capital into buying groceries for her grocery shop. She is certain that she can increase her family's income by making positive changes to her shop.

Note: Zulaikhan is showing her sewing work in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to start a grocery shop again

loans.name: Mrs. Phan Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan S. is a 52-year-old who is the village bank president, selected by the nine members of the group located in Krapeu Troum village in Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of their loan for a different purpose to improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Phan S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Now she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. S., to improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of her loan to hire farm laborers to help her farm.

Mrs. Phan S. is a widow who lives in a three-member household.

The man who sits on the motorbike in the photo is not a member of this village bank.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Melben

texts.en:
Melben S. is from the town of Dumabel, Aglipay, Quirino. He is 38 years old. Melben is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melben owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a chainsaw. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from being a chainsaw operator. Melben has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melben joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melben has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Melben is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services again. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Melben from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Ermina

texts.en:
Ermina I. is currently in the business of selling fish, tomatoes and cabbages at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell. 

Ermina is 33 years old and married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Azeezan

texts.en:
Azeezan lives in Kot Radha Kishen. It is a small city located near Lahore, Pakistan and is known for its dairy products.  Azeezan is a 53 years old lady who has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has completed 10th grade and has started a job in the factory as he couldn’t continue his education. The remaining two children are in 9th grade.  

Azeezan’s husband runs a grocery shop and in the evening he sells milk. He has six buffaloes at his home. Azeezan takes care of the buffalos in the absence of her husband and gets milk from them so when her husband comes home from work he can sell the milk without any delay. 

Azeezan lives in a four room brick house. Part of the house is dedicated for the buffalo while other rooms are used by her family. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband.  His dairy business is going good and giving him good earning.  With the loan he will add large quantities of groceries in  to his grocery shop.  She is hopeful that an investment will result in higher profits from her husband’s business and her family’s financial condition will get better. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan cycle. In previous loan experiences she has proved herself to be a responsible client and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Homegan Kossi

texts.fr: A. est un tenancier de bar qu'il a appelé "ETS FIRST CLASS". les weekends et les vendredis soirs, son bar est très animé. il dispose de Trois employés et s'approvisionne en boissons auprès de la Brasserie de Lomé. son stock de boissons est fini, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui est son deuxième pour acheter 35 casiers de boissons sucrerie et bières et divers pour alimenter son bar. IL est célibataire.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is the manager of a bar he calls “ETS FIRST CLASS.” His bar is very lively on Friday nights and on weekends. He has three employees and gets his stock of drinks from the Lomé Brasserie. As his stock of drinks is depleted, he is requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy 35 cases of various sweetened drinks and beers to supply his bar. He is a bachelor.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of drinks

loans.name: Gulhumor's Group

texts.en:
Gulhumor S., the group’s leader, is 41, married to an electrical inspector, and the mother of four children, all of them schoolboys. The family is engaged in cattle breeding and farming, enterprises inherited from parents. As well, Gulhumor earns her living by working as a teacher. From their earning the family has managed to make house repairs and build a kitchen. They are requesting a loan in order to purchase a calf to raise and then sell.

Gulnar J., the treasurer of the group, is a 51-year-old widow raising two children, a 15-year-old son and a 13-year-old daughter, both students. She earns her living by cattle breeding and farming, and also works as a school teacher. Out of earnings she has managed to make house repairs. Gulnar hopes to get a loan in order to purchase a cow to increase her stock, and in the future hopes to arrange her children's weddings, obtain a car, and expand her business.

Saidahon M., 41 and married to a seller, is the mother of three children, all students. The family earns money by farming, cultivating cotton, rice, corn, carrots and turnips. Earnings have allowed them to build a cow-shed and install gates. The loan will enable them to purchase land and chemical fertilizers. In the future, Saidahon is planning to build a bath-house and kitchen and make house repairs.

Alibaba K., a 24-year-old bachelor. lives with his mother, sister and brother. His mother is a pensioner already, but also works as a school teacher. Alibaba himself is an expert in resuscitation. The family has a common business, the breeding of cattle. Earnings from that enterprise have given them the opportunity to purchase a computer. In order to purchase livestock animals, the family hopes to get a loan, and in the future Alibaba is planning to purchase a house, marry and increase the cattle stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en: Tarek is a 34-year-old single man from Tyre, who works selling and fixing car tires. He started in 1998 and has 15 years experience. Tarek is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua to buy an improved wheel-fixing machine and an air compressor — both necessary to his business. He hopes to expand his business and buy new improved machines.

loans.use: To buy a new wheel-fixing machine and air compressor

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen Nanyanga is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single with one child who is not currently in school. Hellen has had a clothing business for two years.         

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hellen hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her child. In the future, Hellen hopes to own a big salon.       Hellen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge da los servicio de transporte urbano en una tricimoto,  vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar esta ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

El era guardia de seguridad pero como no pasaba tiempo con su familia decidió retirarse e independizarse. Con unos ahorros pudo comprar una moto y remodelarla en la parte de atrás para convertirla en una tricimoto. En la actualidad le va muy bien ya que donde vive no hay buses y la gente no tiene como transportarse. Todos los días el sale a trabajar desde la 05h30am en su moto cobrándoles a cada pasajero $ 0.25 por destino. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques para construir el cuarto de su futuro hijo. En el futuro quiere comprar otra moto y terminar los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Jorge provides urban transportation services with his covered, three-wheeled motorcycle (tricimoto).  He lives on the Perimetral de Guayaquil, a periurban zone that is surrounded by a marsh and has all the basic services.   

He used to work as a security guard, but he wasn't able to spend much time with his family so he decided to retire from this profession and work for himself.  With his savings he was able to buy a motorcycle and refashion the back part and convert it into a tricimoto.  Currently, things are going well for him as there are no buses where he lives and people don't have transportation.  He leaves for work every day at 5:30 am in his vehicle and charges each passenger $0.25 per destination.

With the loan he wants to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and concrete blocks to build a room for his unborn child.  In the future, he wants to buy another motorcycle and to successfully finish his studies.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, sand and concrete blocks to build a room onto his house

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El Sr.  Demetrio está casado con la señora Dalia que se     dedica a la  confección de ropa,  él se dedica a la peluquería, cuyo negocio está ubicado   en el barrio Boquerón de C.D.E. el trabajo del  mismo es gratificante, ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de cliente, y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresario exitoso y en constante progreso.
Es muy cumplidora con sus compromisos por lo que merece el debido apoyo para seguir creciendo.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de compra de telas  para confecciones que realiza su señora y también aprovecha para comprar algunas herramientas de trabajo que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Sr. Demetrio is married to Sra. Dalia who makes clothes for a living. He manages a barber shop located in the neighborhood of Boquerón in Ciudad del Este. Demetrio finds his work rewarding since he has a considerable number of customers and generates an income that is quite satisfactory. With the help of his wife he is able to move forward with determination, effort, and dedication. Today he has become a successful entrepreneur who makes constant progress. He is dutiful to his commitments and deserves the appropriate support to keep growing.

Demetrio is requesting a loan to buy fabrics for his wife’s sewing business. He will also take advantage of this opportunity to purchase some equipment that he lacks for his job.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for his barber shop & fabric for his wife's sewing business

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette E. is 48 years old, married, and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   a general store, a ready-to-wear clothes business, and an Avon products business.  

She lives in Prk. 9 Acco, Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 15 yrs and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, ready-to-wear clothes and Avon products businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.   She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Suzette is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell.   This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Suzette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase stocks to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica a al venta de condimentos, ella compra por quintales y vende  en bolsitas entrega a tiendas a negocios en el mercado y de esta forma genera ingresos para su familia, ella vive en una zona alejada de la ciudad, su casa consta de tres cuartos de adobe, su esposo es transportista trabaja con un micro en la línea que pasa por su casa,  ella fue una de las primeras familias asentadas en esa zona el tiempo para ir a su domicilio es de 45 minutos. La señora es muy responsable con sus cuentas en el primer ciclo ella no presentó atrasos, con el dinero del crédito comprara condimentos por quintales, para así empezar a embolsar para esta fiestas de fin de año ya que muchas personas le compran para condimentar las riquísimas picanas y los lechones al horno, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Juana dedicates herself to the sale of condiments.  She purchases by quintal and sells her product in little bags which she delivers to stores and businesses in the market and in this way she earns income for her family.  

She lives in an area far from the city, her house has 3 adobe rooms, her husband is a bus driver for a company that passes right by their home.  She was one of the first people to move into her neighborhood.  It takes her 45 minutes to get home.  She is very responsible with her accounts and was never late on any of her payments with her first loan.  With the money from her loans, she purchases condiments by quintal, this way she can save for new years parties when many people will purchase from her to season delicious steaks and baked ham.  She is very thankful of Emprender for the support she has received.

loans.use: Business expenses, purchase of dyes, oregano, and pepper

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem L. is a 51-year-old married woman and a local villager in the province of Kompong Tom. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different types of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops and they are growing well. She has been in the farming business since 1990. She often gets good results in both dry seasons and rainy seasons. This couple is blessed with five children, three of whom are single, and two are married. Currently, her house is in the process of being built, but it is not complete yet because she lacks some money to buy more wood for ongoing building. That is why Sem L. would like to request a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy wood for building her house.

loans.name: Sart

texts.en: Sart T., 23, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. T. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a designer, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. T. appears in the photograph while she is cooking.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: José Eliodoro

texts.es: El Sr. José Eliodoro P. R. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como Técnico control de Vectores tiene  Veinte y un  años  de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para sufragar unos gastos personales de su hogar, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. José Eliodoro P. R. is an active employee of the Ministry of Health, where he works as a Vector Control Technician. He has worked there for 21 years. He has taken out two previous loans through CEPRODEL, both of which he used to buy construction materials to expand and improve his house. He is requesting this loan to cover certain personal household expenses. The previous loans he received through CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to him because they made it possible for him to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: personal expenses; to pay off some debts

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar es chapista, arregla abolladuras y otros problemas de movilidades que han tenido accidentes de tráfico; el crédito lo requiere para adquirir herramientas modernas de trabajo, lo cual facilitara el trabajo en menos tiempo. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingreso que tiene el para mantener a su familia. Vive en casa de su suegra ubicada en la Zona de Tacagua  de la Ciudad La Paz. 

Cesar está casado y tiene un hijo. Está satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.
texts.en: Cesar is a “chapista;” he repairs dents and other problems on vehicles that have been in traffic accidents.  He needs the loan to acquire modern work tools that will facilitate his work and cut time.  This activity is his source of income to support his family.  He lives in his mother-in-law’s house located in La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  Cesar is married and has a son.  He’s satisfied with the loans we’ve granted him.

loans.use: To buy tools for his auto detailing job.

loans.name: La Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "La Virgen de Guadalupe" se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, las clientas decidieron llevar este nombre en honor a la patrona del pueblo. En este grupo se encuentra la señora Matilde Martínez A. quien es una integrante del grupo y se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace mas de 5 años, ella tiene 36 años de edad, casada con el señor Margarito Martínez, con el crédito quiere invertir en materia prima y seguir trabajando a lado de su esposo y con ello estar al pendiente de sus hijos, puesto que el menor de ellos apenas cumplió 3 años de edad, la ilusión que tiene doña Matilde es que sus hijos se formen como unos hombres de bien y algún día puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, a pesar que la señora solo cuenta con la educación primaria le gustaría tener un hijo profesionista. En este mismo grupo se encuentra la señora Margarita F. González, de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, la señora nos platica que después de estudiar la educación secundaria ya no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando por falta de recursos económicos y que vio en la necesidad de trabajar, entre ella y su esposo decidieron poner una tienda en su comunidad y con ello tener tiempo para el cuidado de sus hijos, con el crédito quiere invertirlo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group, called The Virgin of Guadalupe, is located in the state of Mexico. The clients decided to use this name in honor of the patron saint of the town. 

Ms. Matilde M., a member of this group, has worked selling bread for more than five years. She is 36 years old and married to Mr. Margarito M.. With this loan she wants to invest in supplies and continue working at the side of her husband and with him be devoted to their children since the youngest is just three years old. Doña Matilde hopes they grow up to be successful men and that one day they can have a better quality of life. Even though she has just a primary education, she would like to have a son with a profession. 

In this same group is Ms. Margarita F. González who is 28 years old, married, and has four children. She tells us that after studying through secondary school she did not have the opportunity to continue her studies because of a lack of economic means and so she saw the need to work. She and her husband decided to start a store in their community and with that business still have time for the care of their children. With this loan they want to invest in their business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María del Socorro; la socia tiene 57 años D. edad, separada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia brinda el servicio D. alimentación y bebidas a las distintas clases D. eventos que requieran su servicio como matrimonios, bautizos, fiestas D. 15 años, aniversarios entre otros mas, este servicio se le denomina catering, 
la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio, a la vez la socia trabaja en una institución privada pero le dedica más tiempo a su negocio. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. insumos para su negocio como pisco, jarabe D. goma, tequila, entre otros para bebidas y para los alimentos arroz, aceite, papas todo lo que sea referente a comida. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank ” EL AMANECER”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. María del Socorro. The member is 57 years old, divorced and has 3 children. The members offers a food and drink service at certain types of events that require her service such as weddings, baptisms, quinceaneras, and anniversaries among others. This is a catering service. The member brings good experience to this business. While the member works in a private institution, she dedicates most of her time to her business. 

The member is requesting the loan to buy ingredients for her business such as grappa, syrup, tequila, among other things for drinks and food such as rice, oil, potatoes and other food items. 

The member is happy because of the loan and promises to fulfill her required payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as grappa, syrup, tequila, among other things for drinks and food such as rice, oil, potatoes and other food items.

loans.name: Sophay

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophay H. (pictured above), 40, is a weaver. She has three daughters, two are in school and another is still young. Her husband, Mr. Sal Sen, is a construction worker. The family lives across the Mekong River and about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophay hopes to continue her weaving business, so she is asking for a loan of US$100 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Mr. Jomar S. is from the village of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City. He is 33 years old, married, and has one infant child. To make a living, Jomar owns and operates a motorcab business, picking up passengers in the local community. Jomar has been engaged in his business for three years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In December 2010, Jomar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. 

Jomar is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to fully finance and repair for his motorcab. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to fully finance and repair for his motorcab.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y está embarazada de su primer hijo. Su esposo estudia y trabaja en la empresa eléctrica, ella estudia el primer semestre de enfermería en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Ella además de estudiar también se dedica al comercio, vende  productos Saysons Y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana durante casi todo el dia aunque también vende en la universidad  donde estudia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Recién el mes pasado empezó con esta actividad y le va muy bien. También realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo que tiene un taller de soldadura en el cual realiza muchas obras con el hierro, elabora puertas, ventanas, estructuras para techos, entre otras cosas.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y materia prima como suelda, hierro, latón, etc. para el negocio del esposo. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son obtener su titulo y conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Río de Oro” (River of Gold) communal bank meets every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, a city known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met María, 19, here.  She is married and expecting her first child.  Her husband is a student and employed by the electric company.  She is studying first semester of Nursing at the Manabí Technical University.

Besides studying she’s also a merchant.  She sells Saisons and L'Bel brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works weekends almost the entire day but she also sells at the university where she attends classes.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.   She just started this activity last month and is doing very well.  She is also taking out the loan for her husband’s business.   He has a welding shop where he does all kinds of work with iron.  He makes doors, windows and roofing structures, among others.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and raw materials like solder, iron, brass, etc. for her husband’s business.  This is the second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dreams are to graduate and get a good job.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, creams, solder, iron, brass, etc.

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
La señora María Elsa es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, es madre soltera y con un hijo. Se desempeña como enfermera en un puesto de salud de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de cinco años para la mejor salud de los habitantes.

Cuenta con su propia vivienda la que pretende mejorar poco a poco para el bienestar de su hijo y por eso una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir materiales de construcción como ladrillos,  cemento, arena y zinc mejorar y ampliar una habitación, por tal razón decidió solicitar el crédito con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
María Elsa is from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón. She is a single mother of one child. She works as a nurse in a health center in the area. She has worked there for more than five years to improve the health of the residents. 

She has her own house which she intends to improve little by little for the wellbeing of her son. That is why one of the things she needs at this time is to acquire construction materials such as bricks, cement, sand and zinc sheeting to enlarge a room. That is why she decided to ask for her fourth loan from Ceprodel, with the purpose of filling her need.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a thirty five year old married mother with four children who owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has been in the transport business for two years in which she started with one motorcycle and now has two motorcycles. Her hardship is a lack of enough capital and her vision is for more motorcycles. Sophia needs money to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 55 years old and married with eight children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari sari store.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from carenderia and vegetables vending.

Zenaida aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle for transporting eggs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Sonia nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 35 años de edad. Actualmente, Sonia vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y tiene cuatro hijos y donde desarrolla sus actividades. Sonia tiene pequeña tienda denominada “Multiservicios Sonia” y está ubicada en el centro histórico de la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. Los servicios que ofrece son; venta de paquetes turísticas, locutorio, internet y revelado de fotografías. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar computadoras. Su sueño de la socia es construir su casa. (Ella en la fotografía está acompañada de su esposo y una de sus hijas).
texts.en:
Sonia is a hard-working and responsible person.  Owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's 'Chaska' community bank.

Sonia tells us that she was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She is 35 years old and currently lives in the same city in which she was born.  This is also where she carries out her business activities.  She has four children.

Sonia has a small store called "Mutiservicios Sonia" which is located in the historic center of the Imperial City of Cusco.  The services that she offers are selling tourist packages, offering a public phone service, offering internet services and developing photos.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Sonia needs a loan to buy computers.  Her dream is to build a house.  In the photo she is accompanied by her husband and one of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy a 48-year-old woman who lives in West Point. She stopped her education at only grade seven. She is married with seven children ages 12 to 31. All of her children live at home with her. Nancy, whose husband is out of a job, has to sell charcoal for the survival of her family. Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the times she realizes a profit and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucía es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es una señora luchadora que cuenta con su familia y la que siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de ropa usada la que tiene muchos años de realizarla al lado de sus hijas.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia como madre soltera y construir su propia vivienda, adquirir sus bienes del hogar. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es adquirir un préstamo para contar con más capital para así diversificar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por tal razón decidió solicitar su séptimo crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad
texts.en:
Sra. Lucía is originally from the town of El Sauce. She is a determined woman who lives with her family and has always engaged in the retail trade. Lucía currently has her own business in which she has been selling used clothing for many years with the help of her daughters.

From the beginning, her business has been known for being able to meet the demands of her customers. Thanks to her efforts, Lucía has been able to move her family forward as a single mother. She also was able to build her own home and acquire household goods.

One of her needs is to acquire a loan to increase her capital. This will allow her to diversify her business and satisfy the demand of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her seventh loan from CEPRODEL in order to fulfill this need.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 59 years old and  married to Ann. They are blessed with two children, aged twenty-five and twenty years. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 11,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy a piece of land to expand his farming. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes are to develop his farming a lot which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to expand farming.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 47 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 21 años respectivamente. Ella vive en el municipio de Soledad, desarrolla la actividad de docente y también es una gran emprendedora; pues tiene un negocio de confecciones en el que se dedica a la producción de uniformes deportivos   y a otras líneas en generales,  porque además trabaja todo tipo de ropa sobre medida y por encargo. Sus principales clientes son los que venden en almacenes deportivos del centro de la ciudad, y comités de deportes regionales, además de los  sectores aledaños; Su meta es lograr un crecimiento importante hasta lograr convertirse en una distribuidora de ropa deportiva para toda la costa. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo que maneja, pues la clientela gradualmente se incrementa  y le resulta insuficiente para lograr un servicio efectivo. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará una máquina plana que agilice el proceso de acabado y con ello incrementará su potencial productivo. Carmen maneja su negocio con mucha disciplina, y se esmera en lograr lo que se propone, sus estados financieros muestran cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 10 días una rotación de inventarios de 8 días, mientras su autonomía es del 99,6%. Y   desde estos indicadores se potencializa su crecimiento empresarial
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, is married and has two children, ages 13 and 21.  She lives in the town of Soledad and works as a teacher but is also an entrepreneur who has a sewing business and makes sports uniforms and other general clothing.  Her garments are made to order.  Her main customers are the sporting goods stores in the center of town, the regional sports committees and the village areas.  Her goal is to grow enough to become a distributor of sports clothes along the entire cost.  

Her greatest challenge is having enough work capital because her customer base is increasing and she does not have enough funds to offer an effective service.  With her credkiva, her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she will buy a flat machine which will facilitate the finishing process so she can increase her productivity.  Carmen manages her business with much discipline and works hard to reach her goals.  Her accounts show a record of accounts-receivable of every 10 days and an inventory turnover of 8 days.  Her autonomy rating is 99.6%.  Her business growth will be based on these factors.

loans.use: To buy a flat machine to facilitate the finishing process.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam has been operating a tailoring shop for the last 10 years in Emali town. She is 32 years old and married to Joel. They have three children in school. Mirriam was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy materials for making dresses, trousers and shirts. In the future, Mirriam hopes to expand her business and diversify into other income-generating businesses.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dresses, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa, tiene 30 años vive en concubinato, tienen 4 hijos pequeños los  cuales dependen de sus ingresos, viven en la comunidad de Esquilan Chico en una pequeña casa, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 2 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y una cabeza de ganado preñada, la  leche vende a PIL, que es una empresa dedicada a la fabricación de productos lácteos.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de un tanque de enfriamiento, dicha compra se está realizando por un grupo de personas los cuales no contaban con un tanque para acumular la leche, actualmente existe otro tanque,  pero es demasiado lejos para transportar la leche y depositarla alli, con la compra de dicho tanque se beneficiaran todo el grupo porque se instalara en la zona.
 Entre sus sueños y metas es, en futuro contar con una granja pequeña, y realizar una nueva construcción de su domicilio ya que la tiene la construcción está en mal estado.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa, 30, has a spouse and four small children who depend on her income.  They live in the community of Esquilan Chico in a small house.  Her main activity is raw milk production.  She currently owns two heads of dairy cattle in production and one pregnant cow.  She sells the milk to PIL which is a firm dedicated to manufacturing dairy products.

The loan is to buy a cooling tank.  This purchase is being undertaken by a group of people who did not have a milk storage tank.  Currently, there is another tank in existence but it’s too far away to transport the milk there to be stored.  The purchase of said tank will benefit the entire group because it will be installed in the area.

Among her dreams and goals for the future are to have a small farm and start to build a new house because the one she has built now is in poor condition.

loans.use: to pay her share of a raw milk cooling tank.

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and father of two children.

Jabbar has owned a shop since 2007, selling mobile phones, accessories and rechargeable cards. He has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.


He decided to apply for a $2900 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more merchandise. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more goods.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 31-year-old married man, owner of a bookshop since July 2010. He is new in this business and is working hard to improve it. Hassan used to work at a medicine factory, but he insisted on taking the step forward to run his own business. He opened this bookshop with excitement and hope, the hope that he will succeed and won’t regret this step.

 Hassan is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a color photocopy machine, very important and highly requested in his business, and to increase his business products with special cardboard, painting brushes, pens and many other student-requested materials to reach a level where everything is available.

Hassan hopes that his bookshop will be the number one in the region; it only needs patience and hard work, as he states.

loans.use: To buy a new improved color photocopy machine and other supplies.

loans.name: Francia Elena

texts.es: En su pequeño taller de confecciones, esta gran mujer madre de un joven de 20 años, sueña con tener la máquina fileteadora y los insumos necesarios para poder seguir con esta bella actividad. Al obtener el préstamo comprará materia prima e insumos como Hilos telas, accesorios y otros para la confección, así podrá aumentar sus ingresos y organizar mejor su negocio, además, podrá ofrecerle empleo a algunos miembros de su familia que igualmente tienen grandes necesidades. El esfuerzo diario hace que se levante con más ánimos para seguir adelante y buscar las mejores oportunidades para su negocio y sobre todo para su hijo.
texts.en: In her small sewing workshop this great mother of a 20-year-old son dreams with owning a serger sewing machine and the necessary supplies to continue with her beautiful occupation.  Upon obtaining the loan she will buy raw materials and supplies like thread, fabric, accessories and others for sewing to increase income and better organize her business.  In addition, she’ll be able to offer employment to some of her family members who also have great needs.  The daily effort causes her to get up each day with more determination to continue forward seeking the best opportunities for her business and, above all, for her son.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle, which has enabled him to support his eight household members.

Since it has been his desire to own many motorcycles, Robert needs the loan to buy a second motorcycle for transportation and to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Jowy

texts.en:
Jowy is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Jowy is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 1 year. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Jowy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Jowy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Juana Gelsamina

texts.es:
Juana Gelsamina M. es una comerciante de 34 años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro hijos y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio Centro en la comunidad de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Hace seis años su madre le enseñó a trabajar para que día a día se pudiera ganar el sustento. Desde ese tiempo ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y abarrotería en su casa de habitación, su horario de atención es desde las 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm y mientras ella cuida su negocio tres de sus hijos se van a la escuela.  

Con el financiamiento obtenido podrá surtir su negocio de venta de ropa de estilos actuales y acordes a la temporada navideña y de esa forma podrá llamar la atencion de mas personas y aumentar sus ventas. Tambien desea surtir su pulperia de más y variados productos comestibles como ser carnes, lacteos, embutidos, condimentos, pollo, entre otros. 

Con el apoyo del préstamo espera seguir  ayudando a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar, y ahorrar para poder alquilar un local que tenga una muy buena ubicación. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos sanos y que se conviertan en personas que contribuyan a la construcción de una mejor sociedad. Con los prestamos obtenidos en FAMA ha podido ir mejorando su vida económica.
texts.en:
Juana Gelsamina M. is a merchant.  She’s 34, married, and the mother of four children.  She and her family live in the central neighborhood of San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho.  Six years go her mother taught her to work so that she could support herself day to day.  Since then she’s been selling clothing and groceries from her home.  She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm and her children attend school.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her business with current styles of clothing for the Christmas season so that she can attract more people and increase her sales.  She also wants to stock her grocery business with a greater variety of products such as meats, milk products, sausages, condiments, and chicken among other things.

She expects the support from this loan to allow her to continue helping her husband support the household and also allow her to rent a shop in a good location.  Her dream is to see her children grow healthy and become people who will contribute to the betterment of society.  The loans she’s gotten through FAMA have helped her improve her financial life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and groceries.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 36 years-old and lives in Congo Town; she is single with four children aged 3 and 15 years old.  They are attending school and live at home. 

Musu has been operating a photo studio for the past ten years. She says her main challenge is sometimes customers take photos and they don’t pay the balance of fees owing. She started this business with money that she earned (as a cook) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her increased profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials (camera, cloths, etc.) for her business, in the future she want to send her children to a good university.

loans.use: to purchase more materials (camera, cloths, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es:
Ana se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 12, 4 y 3 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que esta generando su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, Ana esta en la búsqueda de montar su propio negocio para así contribuir económicamente a mejorar los ingresos del hogar. Tiene experiencia de 3 años en la actividad de la venta de comidas rápidas, por esto quiere aprovechar esta experiencia y montar su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas con el cual pueda generar ingresos para su hogar mejorando las condiciones económicas. Debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, Ana busca que un préstamo le permita comprar un carro de comidas rápidas, utensilios de cocina y surtido de alimentos para la preparación de sus comidas, y así iniciar su propio negocio.

De esta manera Ana espera que pueda generar ingresos con los cuales les pueda brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, y principalmente a su hijo mayor de 18 años el acceso a una educación universitaria. Ana sueña con sacar su familia adelante brindándoles un estudio de buena calidad a todos sus hijos y permitiéndoles tener una estabilidad económica que les permita progresar.

loans.use: Comprar un carro de comidas rápidas, utensilios de cocina y surtido de alimentos para la preparación de sus comidas, y así iniciar su propio negocio.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Sally a very hardworking, honest and humble mother who is only 32 years of age. Sally hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya an area nicknamed “home of champions”, because it has produced some of the best athletes in the world. Sally is married and is blessed with 6 beautiful children that she really loves and adores because they always put a smile on her face and you can always notice a pleasant feeling when she is at home. Sally is one of the most hardworking women on earth and has been doing farming for the past 4 years. Through hard work she has been able to earn a decent and honest income.

Sally loves dairy farming a lot and because of the passion that she has she has even nicknamed one of the cows “Lelmet ”and this always makes her very proud when she sees her dairy cow. 

Eldoret area has got a large population and a large market for milk hence Sally wants to take advantage of this and increase her milk supply. Sally has got a large space in her farm and because of this she is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow so that she can get more income. Sally is a very enterprising woman and she projects that through the profits she will be getting she will be able to provide a secure future for her family and also assure them of a bright future. 

Sally is confident that through your loan her life will never be the same again because she is planning to buy another dairy cow so that she will be able to supply more milk hence make more profits.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell herbal medicines business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.  Vilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of herbal medicines to sell to customers.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Madam Paulina D. is the owner of the With God Retail Shop. She sells items such as soaps, sugar, washing powder, sweets, tins of milk, fish etc. The demand for her goods in her locality is very high. She however, doesnt sell all the items that she wishes to sell. Even the items that she sells are not enough because Madam Paulina D. is a very hardworking woman and it has been her desire to own a bigger shop and sell more goods. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to fulfill this desire. She is also very capable of paying back the loan.

loans.use: to expand the items sold in her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Mrs Timotea S. A. has already had her business for 9 years, a beauty salon, which is the source of the majority of her family's income. As she is now a single mother of 2, she has advanced her business on her own. She is asking for a loan of $1,200.00 dollars in order to re-arrange her business and by which improve customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Sra. Timotea S. A. tiene ya mas de 9 años en el negocio de la estética es su mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Ya que es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos el cual ha sacado adelante ella sola. Esta solicitando un préstamo de $1.200.00 Dlls para arreglar su negocio, y así darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To install a wooden roof.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a fashion designer and also sells drinks to her community. She needs a loan to purchase more drinks and sewing material, to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar carpas y mesas para su local

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira B. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a fabric stand in the town of Khachmaz, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Elmira is 37 years old and has been working in this business with her husband for the last six years. She and her husband have two children. Elmira has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit and is currently requesting a loan of $825 so that she can purchase more material for her business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Ya, 49, has been divorced and supporting her family as a single mother for nearly 18 years. She has five children, ages 18-28, who are all grown and working to help support the family. Now, four still live at home in addition to a son-in-law and newborn child. Ya has been a farmer for over 20 years, following the fall of Khmer Rouge regime. She grows cauliflower and two kinds of squash which she rotates with corn. In the plot of land behind her home, she is able to plant two cycles per year with the water available.

Ya is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to purchase vegetable seeds and a wooden cart for transporting her produce to the larger markets in Phnom Penh. Previous loans were used to purchase a water pump and motorbike. With a new cart, Ya will no longer have to hire a motor-taxi every time she wants to sell. Instead, she can connect the cart to her moto and make the trip by herself, saving time and money.

loans.use: Buy vegetable seeds and a wooden cart

loans.name: Nabweru North A-2078(Iv) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for five months. Jane is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells raw foods in the market. Jane wants to use the extra profits to cater for the childrens' school fees and other necessities like clothing and medical care. Damalie sells used clothes and wants to add inventory with the loan. Prisca has a poultry business and wants to use the loan to purchase drinkers (for poultry to drink from) and poultry feeds. Zaina sells charcoal. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more raw foods from villages

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has two businesses located at Tandika market in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a food cafe and also sells used clothing. She has employed two people who help her in her businesses.

Her cafe accommodates close to six customers at a time, but Rehema needs a loan to help her expand her cafe so she can accommodate more.

loans.use: To expand cafe.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 29 years old and is divorced with 2 children, ages 10 months and 9 years old. Fatuma is a clothes seller; she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Victoria V. U. belongs to the "Eucalyptus Communal Bank". She lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. She resides at the Mz F Lt 2 San Jose Street in the Tarapotillo sector, where her general store is also located

The opportunity of a loan with the communal bank has allowed her to develop her business and be with her children, reason why she left a dependable job. She is thankful to the communal bank because she was able to expand her business and satisfy the needs of her family.

With the 500.00 soles (Peruvia currency), which will be paid back in 4 months, Mrs. V. will buy sacks of rice, sugar and other groceries according to her customers' needs and orders.

Mrs. Rosa Victoria is 48 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children, she loves her business and makes her husband and her children participate and provide customer service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Victoria V. U. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en la Región San Martín ,Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en Calle San José Mz F Lt 2 en el sector Tarapotillo, donde también se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. La oportunidad de un préstamo en el Banco Comunal le permite desarrollar este negocio y poder estar junto a sus hijos, motivo por el cual dejó un trabajo dependiente y agradece al Banco Comunal porque pudo ampliar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Con el crédito por S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: sacos de arroz, azúcar, y algunos otros abarrotes más, de acuerdo a los pedidos de los clientes. La señora Rosa Victoria tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, le encanta el negocio y hacer participar a su esposo e hijos en la atención a los clientes.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes Mondragon V. stands out as a very hard worker who is dedicated to her business in the city of Chinandega. She runs her own nursery where she grows fruit trees and plants. From the time she began her business she has been able to grow her income and help cover the expenses for her family, including the costs of educating her young children who depend on her.

With her business, she has managed to overcome difficult economic circumstances with the help of Ceprodel, whose support has enabled Mercedes to invest in more seeds and tools needed to cultivate them. As her business continues to grow, she is requesting a new loan to invest again in more seeds and materials needed to continue to succeed.

La señora Mercedes Mondragon V. se ha destacado en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega por ser una muy buena trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de la agricultura en su propio vivero frutal y forestal que atiende en su localidad. Desde que inició el negocio h a logrado salir adelante en las necesidades de su hogar y ha podido brindarle estudios a su pequeño hijos que por cierto depende de ella para subsistir.

Por medio del negocio ha superado sus condiciones económicas gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual al otorgarle créditos ha ayudado a que se desarrolle su actividad por lo que la señora M. muy sabiamente los invierte en la compra de la semilla y asistencia técnica para los cultivos. Una vez mas hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de semilla e insumos para el cultivo forestal.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SEEDS AND MATERIALS NEEDED TO FOR HER NURSERY.  THIS WILL ENABLE HER TO CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS AND TAKE CARE OF HER YOUNG CHILDREN.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce pasties and candies.

loans.name: Navin

texts.en:
Mrs. Navin V. lives in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. Her husband, Mr. Von At, is a village chief and he usually helps his wife on the rice field too. They have three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is enrolled in school.

Although Mrs. Navin V.’s family members have different business activities, they still live under poor conditions. Thus, Mrs. Navin V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Previously, Mrs. Navin V. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her grocery business. She has fully paid off her original loan. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel worked as a factory worker, but after seeing that with his salaries he was not covering his family’s expenses, and because of his knowledge of tin and paiting, he decided to start his own business four years ago. To date, the business has done very well, and each day, it has been growing.

He needs a loan for $250 which he will repay in three months to buy tools for work. With your support, he will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Manuel trabajaba como empleado de una fábrica, pero al ver que con su sueldo no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares y debido a los conocimientos que tenia en hojalatería y pintura, decidió poner su propio negocio, hace 4 años, con el cual a la fecha le ha ido muy bien y cada día ha ido creciendo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying tools for work

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.en:
The Estrellas ("Stars") group is made up of five men and eight women who live in Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. Most of the group members sell clothing: Jose Manuel, Rocio, Venancia, Shirley, Elvis, Luis, Reyna, Suzana, Carolina and Griselda. Of the remaining group members, Javier is in another type of commerce, Milfred sells prepared meals, and Carlos sells boards. Most of the group members plan to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

Most of the group members have five years of experience or less in their respective businesses, though three members have more than ten years' experience and Venancia has 25 years of experience.

The group was originally made up of 15 people, but two group members did not show up for the loan disbursal so they were excluded from the group.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

esta fotografia corresponde al banco comunal las estrellas constituido por cuatro varones y ocho mujeres o este desembolso no asistieron dos socias quienes fueron escluidas del banco.

loans.use: Buy bulk clothing to resell

loans.name: Shamo

texts.en:
Shamo Y. is 25 years old. Shamo sells men’s and women’s shoes in the central market of Sabirabad city. With over six years of working at the market, Shamo has enough experience to do his work successfully, and he has clients who always come back to him. 

Shamo is trying to satisfy the needs of all his customers, whatever their tastes and income levels. Shamo wants to increase his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Shamo promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks you for supporting him. Be an important part of the growth of Shamo’s business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es:
Doña  Yitza Margarita M. Q. tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene un hijo de la edad de la edad de 18 años que esta cursando el 2 año de secundaria, también tiene un nieto a su cargo de la edad de 12 años y cursa el 2 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora de comerciante, los deseos que ella tiene son de sacar adelante a su hijo quien tiene problemas en el cerebro y cubrir los gastos que tiene de su enfermedad ya que los medicamentos  son muy caros  y el mejor medio de ayuda para ella es por este negocio por lo que la fundación le brindo la ayuda por medio de este crédito y tener así su línea de crédito.

Esta señora tiene la actividad económica de mercadería de ropa en  general  por lo que a sus clientes les ofrece los productos de: ropa para damas, para caballeros, sabanas, calcetines para caballeros, Doña Yitza tiene 4 años de tener su negocio, sus inicios comienzan por la idea de buscar un trabajo que le generara ingresos a su familia debido a que las ganancias que su esposo aportaba no eran las suficientes para sufragar los gastos de la casa así como los de su hijo y fue por esto que ella decide establecerse en su casa logrando atraer a sus clientes y ofrecerse la variedad de productos que ella dispone, el motivo del financiamiento es para invertir en su capital de trabajo ya que las compras las realizara en Managua donde tiene la posibilidad de comprar al por mayor y así recibir un promedio de ganancia mas alto y mantenerse en el mercado de una forma activa   y agradece el la oportunidad que fundación León 2000 le ha brindado por medio del financiamiento.
texts.en:
59-year old Doña Yitza Margarita M. Q. is married and has an 18-year old son who is in his second year of secondary school. She is also responsible for her 12-year old grandson who is in the second grade of primary school. Her partner is a businessman. Doña Yitza’s wishes are to see her son do well—he is mentally challenged--and to be able to cover the cost of his medications which are very expensive. Her main source of help is through her business which the Foundation is supporting through this loan and a line of credit. Doña Yitza’s business is selling clothing, and she offers her customers the following products: clothing for women and men, sheets, and men’s socks. She started the business four years ago with the idea of finding work that would bring in an income for her family, as the money that her husband earned was not enough to cover the household’s costs as well as those of her son. So she decided to set up a business in her home managing to attract customers and offer them a variety of products. The purpose of this loan is to provide capital so that she can make purchases in Managua at wholesale prices and thus earn a higher profit on what she sells. In this way she will maintain an active presence in the market. She is grateful for the opportunity that the León 2000 Foundation has given by providing her with financial assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tièssiri  (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri  est un regroupement de 4  femmes  qui se connaissent bien. Elles vivent dans des foyers polygames dans le village de Yangasso préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) et ont en moyenne 40 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 4  enfant.
Elles mènent  une même activité à savoir la préparation et vente de Jouga (un couscous  qui se fait à base de fonio et d’arachide) très prisé par la population locale.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 125.000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de fonio et d’arachide auprès des paysans producteurs des villages  environnants et sur place au marché de Yangasso les jours de foire. Elles préparent à domicile leur plat et effectuent leur vente aux abords de l’école où les élèves et les enseignants pendant les heures de récréation et de pauses viennent s’y restaurer. Elles comptent réaliser chacune en moyenne 150 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle. Dans l’avenir elles envisagent ouvrir une cantine scolaire.
texts.en:
Tièssiri is a group of 4 women who know each other well. They live in polygamous households in the village of Yangasso, prefecture of San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and are on average 40 years old, married, and mothers of at least 4 children.

They each have the same business, namely the preparation and sale of "jouga", a couscous that is made out of "fonio" (a kind of millet) and peanuts, a dish very highly prized by the local population.

To expand the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. The amount of their loans has grown from 50,000 F CFA in the beginning to 125,000 F CFA for their fourth loan.

This loan will be used to buy sacks of "fonio" and of peanuts from the rural producers in surrounding villages and right in Yangasso on market days. They prepare the couscous in their homes and sell it near the school where the pupils and teachers come to eat it during recess and other break-times. They each expect to make on average 150,000 F CFA in profit per cycle. In future they plan to open a school lunch room.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fonio and peanuts

loans.name: Shahnaz M. Ejaz Group

texts.en:
I am Shahnaz and I am 31 years old. I am married with five children: four daughters and one son. All of my children are attending a local school.  I have lived in a city named Arifwala for the last 10 years. I am uneducated. My husband's name is M. E..  He runs a sweetmeat shop in a food market. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. He learned this business from his father. I run a sewing center where I teach children how to sew dresses. I use my income to pay my children’s school tuition fees. I have successfully repaid my two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, sugar and dry fruits) for my husband’s sweetmeat business.
