I am a group leader with two other women from my town. Sajnan baji wants a loan to pay for an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kalsoom baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat shop

loans.name: Godfrey Mwesigwa Group

texts.en: M. Godfrey is the leader of his group and a businessman with a retail shop. He is also a farmer with cows that he keeps at his home and these have been helpful in giving him milk for sale and home consumption. He is married with school-going children and the school fees have not been a burden especially now that he has access to loans that boost his business. He is really grateful for the support.

loans.use: To buy inventory.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy N., 40, works as a construction worker building houses in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. 
She typically makes about US$2 every day. Her husband makes US$4 by working as a construction foreman in Phnom Penh. This couple has one child who is attending school. 
Mrs. Soy N. is asking a loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. This will help reduce her transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to reduce transportation costs.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Mrs. Lida T., 37, and her husband, Mr. Vuth Noun, 46, live in a small village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children attend school and one is still very young. Lida also has her mother is living with her. 

Lida has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been in the army for twenty years. He works at the Air Force Headquarters base in Phnom Penh. 

Lida is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials and set up one more loom for her weaving business. She also wants to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, set up an additional weaving loom and buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.es:
La Señora Cristeta O. de 54 años de edad es separada, tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro son independientes, y el menor de once años está cursando el 7mo. Grado escolar; éste es su mano derecha en el negocio.

En tiempos anteriores, Cristeta era dependiente de un importante centro comercial. Un día cuando se trasladaba a su lugar de trabajo fué victima de un accidente de tránsito. Ella quedo con secuelas físicas del percance, siendo beneficiada con una pequeña pensión por accidente. Así, como buena emprendedora que és, inicia esta actividad comercial en su domicilio con el apoyo de sus hijos. 

El objetivo de este crédito es aprovechar la oportunidad de contar con un mayor volúmen de mercaderías, atendiendo al momento del inicio de clases en las instituciones educativas.
texts.en:
Cristeta O. is 54 years old, separated, and has 5 children, four of whom are independent, and the youngest who is eleven years old is in the 7th grade; the youngest is the right hand of the business. Previously, Cristeta had been dependent on an important mall where she worked. One day while she was on the way to her place of employment she was a victim of a car accident. She was left with physical injuries due to the accident, and was given small settlement as a result. Because she is an enterprising woman, she began this commercial activity in her home with the support of her children. The objective of this loan is to take advantage of the opportunity to acquire more merchandise, paying attention to the beginning of classes in the educational institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Yerba Mate, soft drinks, mineral water, natural juices, various sweets, etc.
